loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bitaha est une commerçante et vice-présidente de l’association d’affaires « Tusaiddiane »,  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 61 ans et mère de 11 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse des condiments et de la pâtisserie(tomates, Oignons, poivrons, piments beignets et galettes). Elle installe ses marchandises tout au long de la rue dans un quartier animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance d’une association de la place. Son conjoint est un pasteur. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 paniers de tomates, 1 d’oignons, ½ sac de farine de format, 5 kg de sucre, 5 litres d’huile etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce, devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants.Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Bitaha is a retailer and the vice-president of the Tusaiddiane business group. She is an experienced and dynamic 61-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 11 children who (have) all attend(ed) school. She sells condiments and pastries (like tomatoes, onions, peppers, chili doughnuts and galette cakes.) She displays her merchandise along the side of the road in a busy district. She started her business with the help of a local association. Her spouse is a pastor. Later on, she benefited from loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for over 20 years. This new loan will be used to buy 2 baskets of tomatoes, one basket of onions, 10 lots of garlic, half a bag of traditional flour, 5 kilos of sugar and 5 litres of oil. She hopes to expand her business, become a wholesaler and be able to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for enabling the self-sufficiency of non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially at this critical time of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of tomatoes, one basket of onions, 10 lots of garlic, half a bag of traditional flour, 5 kilos of sugar and 5 litres of oil.

loans.name: Munguiko Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mulwahali est une commerçante et vice-présidente du groupe  d’affaires «Munguiko », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 48 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des œufs. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue  dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de la tontine réalisée  de ses proches et collaborateurs. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 80 plaquettes des œufs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de conflits à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’au dessus du mur monte un enfant curieux.
texts.en:
Mulwahali is a retailer and the vice-president of the Munguiko business group. She is a dynamic 48-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 2 children who both attend school. She sells eggs and displays her merchandise along the side of the road in a busy district. She started her business using capital she received from a mutual funds group made up of close friends and collaborators. Her spouse is unemployed. Later on, she benefited from loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. This new loan will be used to buy 80 trays of eggs. She hopes to increase her capital, become a wholesaler and be able to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for enabling the self-sufficiency of non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially at this critical time of conflict in the east of the country.

Note: there is a curious child standing on the wall in the picture.

loans.use: to buy 80 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
Damian se siente contento por el apoyo brindado y agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo. El préstamo lo utilizo para comprar un pequeño toro y le fue muy bien. Damian continúa con el  engorde de ganado y a la agricultura. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para animales como pasto.

Damian nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero y él tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene dos hijos. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Damian is content with the support he has received through the loan and is grateful to the lenders.  He used the loan to buy a small bull which was a good investment.  He continues with his livestock farming and agriculture.  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy fodder for the livestock.

Damian was born in the district of Challabamba but lives in the community of Majopata next to the community of Carnicero.  He is 36 years old, has a common-law wife and two children.  (The community of Majopata is in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: To buy animal fodder.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her family. Concepcion is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Concepcion has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gavino

texts.es:
Gavino tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el Caserío de Hualapampa, una zona rural del distrito de Huarmaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, industria artesanal y comercio, ubicado en la Provincia de Huancabamba, perteneciente a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la fabricación de productos de herradura como son machetes, picos , barretas, entre otros, cuenta con un taller ubicado en su propio domicilio teniendo una experiencia de más de 10 años por lo que es muy conocido en la zona, Gavino también ofrece servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi,.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una nueva mototaxi y de esta manera poder alquilarla, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Gavino, 47, lives with his wife and daughter in the rural community of Hualapampa, a rural district in Huarmaca.  The community is dedicated to agriculture, livestock farming, handicrafts and commerce and is located in the province of Huancabamba which belongs to the Piura Region along the northern coast of Peru.

He makes metal products such as machetes, picks, small bars and other items.  His workshop is set up at home and he has over ten years experience so is well-known in the area.  Gavino also runs a public transportation service with his own motortaxi.

Gavino has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN to buy a new motortaxi so he can rent it and earn extra income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a motortaxi.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la agricultura, ella  tiene 66 años de edad, es viuda pero tiene un hijo y pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon” , ella se siente contenta por anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y se siente contenta. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.

Felipa nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
For several years Felipa has made a living raising small animals and farming.  She is 66 years old, a widow and has a son.  She belongs to the communal bank "El Balcon" and is content with the previous loan that was very helpful.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs.

Felipa was born in the district of Challabamba but lives in the community of Majopata, annexed from the community of Carnicero. (Majopata is located in the district of Challabamba, province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco.)

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a business buying and selling accessories in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more accessories to sell.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years now.

Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ester is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Ester has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from bicycle transport. Fe is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jacquilyn

texts.en:
Jacquilyn works hard to support her family. Jacquilyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like hotdog, meat, rice, etc. for her business.

Jacquilyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like hotdog, meat, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like chicken, flour, seasonings, etc. for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like chicken, flour, seasonings, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jospehine

texts.en:
Jospehine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jospehine is 47 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Jospehine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jospehine has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, vinegar, sugar, frozen foods, etc. for her food vending business.

Jospehine has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jospehine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, vinegar, sugar, frozen foods, etc. for her  food vending business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Conchita has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 4 years. Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor costs and a shelling machine.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: El señor Percy  vive con sus padres y  tiene dos hijos pequeños. Es una persona responsable y dedica su tiempo a trabajar y a cuidar de su familia. Tiene un vehículo en el cual brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, trabajando todos los días, pero como es antiguo sufre de algunos desperfectos los cuales le están impidiendo que trabaje con regularidad, por ello solicita un crédito para la reparación de su vehículo y de esta forma podrá brindar un mejor servicio y continuara trabajando para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Percy lives with his parents and has two small children. He is a responsible person and spends his time working and caring for his family. He has a vehicle with which he offers passenger transportation service, working every day. Since it is old, he has some flaws which are stopping it from working regularly. That is why he is asking for a loan for vehicle repair. This way, he can offer a better service and keep working to support his family.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, candies, soft-drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Juditha has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sardines, cooking oil, seasoning and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y esposo en el distrito de Zaña, es una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada estratégicamente por el valle del rio Jetepeque, lo que le ha permitido a su población dedicarse a la agricultura y crianza de ganado vacuno, elaboración artesanal de dulces entre otros, ubicado a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales de corral patos, gallinas, pavos los comercializa en su domicilio y en el mercado de la zona, su esposo brinda servicio de carga en una asno y también se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores cerdos para su negocio y posteriormente engordarlo para ofrecerlo a mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Elsa, 42, lives with her two children and husband in the district of Zaña, a strategically located community on the Jetepeque River.  The location has allowed the local people to be active in agriculture and livestock farming, and artisan pastries, among other things.  It is located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

María Elsa sells small animals such as ducks, hens and turkeys, both at home an at market.  Her husband has a donkey transport business and also sells cattle.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN to buy small animals for her business.  Later she will sell them for a good price and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as turkeys, hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Betty Evelina

texts.es:
Betty Evelina tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su hospitalidad y los deliciosos platillos que ofrecen en los restaurants, de la zona, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pavos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cerdos, comercializándolos en su domicilio y en los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Betty Evelina, 28, lives with her three children in the district of Oyotun, a community known for its hospitality and the delicious cooking offered at restaurants in the area.  The local people are active in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming; and the community is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, northern coast of Peru.

Betty Evelina raises and sells animals such as ducks, turkeys, chickens, and pigs, selling them at home and in neighboring rural districts.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN to buy small animals and balanced feed so she can increase her income for the family.

loans.use: To buy small animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Gady

texts.es:
Gady tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su hospitalidad, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales de corral patos, gallinas, pavos desde hace un año, los comercializa en el mercado de la zona, es una joven emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gady is 22 years old. She lives with her mother in the district of Oyotun, a community characterized by its hospitality. Its residents work in agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She has worked selling poultry such as ducks, chickens and turkeys. She sells them in the area market. She is a young entrepreneur and has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Rebecca is borrowing 9,500 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her general store, such as soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, like soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rogelia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rogelia has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: I Komang

texts.en:
I Komang is 44 years old and lives in Melaya, which is in West Bali. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He has a small kiosk in front of his house where he sells items such as rice, oil, soap, kitchen items, snacks, etc. He has been in this business for five years.  

I Komang is seeking a loan of 10 million IDR from MUK to expand his business. With the loan, he will purchase more snacks to stock in his kiosk. With his earnings, he hopes to be able to pay the school fees for his children and save money for business capital to be used later.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks to stock in his kiosk.

loans.name: Gaffor

texts.ru: Гаффор продолжает свою пекарную деятельность, которое перешло ему от отца. Он ценит свое ремесло, ведь благодаря ему он обеспечивает свою семью. Его жена и дочь тоже помогают ему в выпечке лепешек. Это их семейный бизнес. Полтора года тому назад Гаффор брал кредит для покупки муки и угля. Сегодня он снова обращается за повторным кредитом с этой же целью. На сумму кредита он хочет закупить муку и уголь для выпечки традиционных лепешек.
texts.en: Gaffor continues to run the baking business he inherited from his father.  He really appreciates this buisness, because, after all, it lets him provide for his family.  His wife and daughter also help him bake the flatbreads.  It's their family business.  A year and a half ago, Gaffor took out a loan to buy flour and coal.  Today, he is applying for a repeat loan for the same purpose:  to buy flour and coal in bulk for baking traditional flatbreads.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 41 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Merlinda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Merlinda has been in this business for five years. Merlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ayan Hussein

texts.en:
Ayan Hussein is 20 years old. She studies at the University of Hargeisa in the faculty of Information Technology. Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare her assignments and lessons. She needs a laptop and requested that Kaaba give her a laptop as a loan; then she will pay it back in installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop. 

Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Ayan will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Farah Ali

texts.en:
Farah Ali is 19 years old. She studies at the University of Hargeisa, faculty of business administration. Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare her assignments and lessons. She needs the laptop to improve her accounting skills, and wants to learn some extra accounting packages. Now she is waiting for the laptop. 

Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Farah will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Leonila is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. Ma. Luisa is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marites has been in this business for a year. Marites earns additional income from a general store.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda has a live-in partner and has a business buying and selling recyclable materials in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for three years now.

Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Rosalia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, sugar, oil, etc. for food production for her food vending business.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old and has two children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising poultry.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ruchel

texts.en:
Ruchel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to pay for laborer salary for her business. Ruchel has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from videoke (karoke) rentals.

Ruchel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborer salary for her rice mill operator business.

loans.name: Salkinay

texts.ru: Салкынай 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшему сыну Нурсултану 17 лет, второму сыну Бекболсуну - 13 лет, единственной дочери Айзирек - 15 лет. Дети все учатся в школе. У Салкынай - среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Салкынай знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Салкынай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Салкынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров и 15 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Дойных коров содержит круглогодично дома, присматривают сами, а овец с марта по октябрь месяцы ежегодно выгоняет на пастбища чабану. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салкынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салкынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Salkinay is 36 years old and she and her husband are raising 3 children.  Her eldest, Nursultan, is 17; her youngest son, Bekbolsun, is 13; and her only daughter, Aizirek, is 15.  All her children are in school.  Salkinay has a secondary level education and goes through life with optimism. She knows what she wants and goes after it will everything she has.  Salkinay knows how to plan and properly use her money to reach her goals.

Her family's main income is Salkinay's animal husbandry business, which she started 16 years ago with the purchase of 10,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Salkinay has 5 milk cows and 15 sheep, and she has everything necessary for raising cattle:  a barn for keeping them and nearby pastures.  She keeps the milk cows at home all year so she can look after them herself, but she sends the sheep off with a shepherd from March through October.  Plenty of hay and feed are always ready.  Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Salkinay applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd.  She plans invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the number of cattle she owns, and to save up money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 52 years old and is married with nine children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Shirley is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs. Shirley has been pig fattening for 36 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Kissanga Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 30's, is a divorcee with three children who are still in school. She has been a food-vendor for two years now. She works from 06am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Salma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy the out of stock items in the food store and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought iron sheets and started building her own house.  She will use this loan to buy a good stock of food to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of owing a hotel.

Salma will share this loan with her loan loan group "KISSANGA" with twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of food to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Merlita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her handicraft business.

Merlita has been in this business for five years now.

Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 33 years old and is married with four children.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, bread, chips, etc.

Shirley has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Shirley aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase household stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 55 years old and is married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries. Vicenta has been farming sugarcane for 18 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 49 years of age and has been engaged in manicure and pedicure services for almost four years. To further increase her income, Rosie is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional manicure/pedicure supplies such as nail polish and cuticle remover. Her profits from her business are usually spent on the family's daily expenditures and her children's school allowances. She hopes that through the loan, she will able to earn higher than her usual income and possibly lift her family out of poverty through her hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional manicure/pedicure supplies such as nail polish and cuticle remover.

loans.name: Hune Marie

texts.en:
Hune Marie works hard to support her family. Hune Marie is married and has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines.

Hune Marie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

Hune Marie has been in this business for two years now.

Hune Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is 42 years old and married with five children.

Leni works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Leni has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

Leni aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 44 years old and married with ten children.

Bernadeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Bernadeth has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

Bernadeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and has a live-in partner with two children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sicid Ali

texts.en: Sicid Ali is 32 years old. He is married and has five children. He works at Somtel Company. He needs a laptop  to work efficiently, and he cannot pay the money all at one time. His good news was when he got the Kaaba-Kiva laptop loan. He approached Kaaba MFI and then Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nena is 31 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nena has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Nena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Roquesa works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Roquesa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Roquesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her rope-making business.

Rosita has been in this business for six years. Rosita earns additional income from food-vending.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for making rope.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, coffee, sugar, juice, canned goods, etc. 

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vilma is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Vilma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and utensils for her food-vending business.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Wenelina

texts.en:
Wenelina works hard to support her family. Wenelina is married and has a business buying and selling chocolates and candies in the Philippines.

Wenelina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of chocolates and candies to sell.

Wenelina has been in this business for 12 years now.

Wenelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of chocolates and candies to sell.

loans.name: Mabibo Sokoni Group

texts.en:
Frank, who is in his early 30s, is married with two children; one of them goes to school and the other one is still young.  He has been selling dry food like sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour, salt and cold drinks as well.  He works from 6:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Frank's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use for buying stock of fast moving items like sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and cold drinks.  He dreams of opening another shop with the same items in a different area.

Frank will share this loan with his group "MABIBO SOKONI," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fast moving items like sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and cold drinks

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Jackson, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children who are still at school. He has had several businesses like selling local eggs, chicken, chips and food since 2003.  He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Jackson's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy food cooking supplies, a fridge, a deep freezer, Irish potatoes and cooking oil.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He appreciates the loan. He used the profits to pay school fees, cover household expenses, bought a sofa set and built his house.  He will use this loan to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and Irish potatoes. He dreams of being a successful business man.

Jackson will share this loan with his loan group "SERAKAZI," which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Jipemoyo Group

texts.en:
Christiner, who is in her early 40s, is single and has a boy and five girls who are in school. Christiner currently own a fresh water fish and alcohol drinks business. She has been in these businesses for ten years and works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day. Her projects are doing good and she is able to generate a good monthly profit. 

This is Christiner's 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the fish business to meet her clients' demands. Currently her fish business has grown and she is able to earn extra money to meet her family's needs easier. She has managed to pay back all of her previous loans successfully. With the profit she received, Christiner covered her school fees, family food, shelter and medical expenses. She also ploughed back into her businesses to grow. With this new loan, she will buy stock of fishes and drinks for selling in her business. She dreams to open a big shop selling drinks.

Christiner will share this loan with her loan group" JIPEMOYO," which consist of 2 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business stock of fishes and drinks for selling

loans.name: Acibo

texts.en:
Acibo is 58 years old and has six children. Acibo is married and has one child in school.

Acibo is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Acibo requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed.

Acibo has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Acibo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 18 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Stephanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, soap, canned goods, etc.  Stephanie has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Stephanie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita works hard to support her family. Nonita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nonita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, bread, soap, etc. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Nonita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, bread, soap, etc.

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is a 44-year-old housewife living in the small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri District with her husband, Manik, 49 years old, and with their two children (one son and one daughter). Shephali and her husband are illiterate but can sign their names. Her son paints houses and buildings and her daughter passed her B.A. examination (Bachelor of Arts). They want to give their daughter more higher education and to see her in a good position in society.

Shephali's husband is a tea grower and farms tea on their own land, but their business is not running well due to lack of capital. Shephali wants a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for growing tea on a large scale. The demand for green tea leaves is too high in the area and there are lots of tea gardens. They hope this farming will give them more earnings for their family to run smoothly.

Shephali gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers to grow tea on her own land.

loans.name: Magdalia

texts.en:
Magdalia is 48 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school.  She works very hard to provide for them. Magdalia operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Magdalia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 28,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase items such as shampoo, soap, cream, sugar, bread, etc. to sell. In the future, Magdalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo, soap, cream, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, iron, blocks, beams and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Rukhsorakhon

texts.ru: Эта милая и наивная женщина Рухсорахон. Она жительница города Исфара. Рухсорахон 24 года. У нее двое детей. Сыну 4 года и дочери 2 годика. Ее муж, чтобы обеспечивать семью уехал на заработки в Россию. Рухсорахон тоже ни сидит без дела. Уже год как она разводит крупнорогатый скот. Ей в основном помогает мать, у которой она и научилась этой деятельности. Рухсорахон сейчас собирается увеличить поголовье скота и с такой целью запрашивает кредит для покупки крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: This sweet and innocent-looking woman is Rukhsorakhan. She is 24, has two children — a 4 year-old son, and a 2 year-old daughter — and lives in Isfar. Her husband has gone to work in Russia to support the family. Rukhsorakhan herself doesn’t just sit around idle; she has been working raising cattle for the past year. She receive help from her mother, who taught her all about cattle-raising. Rukhsorakhan is ready to increase her cattle headcount, and for this purpose is requesting a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Pacita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Pacita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like spices, sugar, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like spices, sugar, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Channyl

texts.en: Channyl is 35 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Channyl runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, including coffee, eggs, noodles, soft drinks and milk. She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Channyl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including coffee, eggs, noodles, soft drinks and milk.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jenifer applied for a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients, including sugar, beans, fruits and milk. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jenifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, including sugar, beans, fruits and milk.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is 41 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel is 37 years old, and her children are in school. Maribel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maribel applied for a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 61 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mila applied for a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 21 year, and she has has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Mila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has raised pigs for 3 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en:
Patrocenia is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Patrocenia is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Patrocenia has raised pigs for 5 years and earns additional income from meat vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 63 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zosima operates a dry goods retail business in the Philippines and requests a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Rasana

texts.en:
Rasana is a very strong-minded 44-year-old housewife from the town of Maynaguri and the mother of three children. They are all receiving education. She wants her children to lead very successful lives with good education. Rasana is illiterate and can only sign her name, so giving an education to her children is very important to her.

Her husband is a farmer involved in an agricultural business. He usually cultivates bananas and sells them to the market. Rasana gives assistance to him in his business. She wants a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy banana suckers (seedlings) and fertilizers to cultivate new crops of banana in their field. With the profit, she can purchase more land to increase her business, and she hopes to give a bright future to her children. In the future, she dreams of building a beautiful concrete house, as they do not have a concrete house of their own.

Rasana is grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To buy banana suckers (seedlings) and fertilizer to cultivate a new crop of bananas.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. Nelia is married and has a retail used clothing business in the Philippines.

Nelia requests a  25,000  PHP  loan through NWTF to purchase  bundles of used clothing to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 21 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas works hard to support her family. Lagrimas is married and has a retail rice business in the Philippines.

She requests a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Lagrimas has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Lagrimas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, and canned goods.

Nancy has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, and canned goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, age 34, is a single mother with three children. She makes and sells food and earns a net income of PHP 200 per day. Her profits were deposited in her bank account to save for future emergencies. 

Due to financial constraints she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase food ingredients such as cooking oil, cheddar cheese and flour for empanada making. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to make her income more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for empanada making.

loans.name: Vera Angiely

texts.en: Vera Angiely, a single mom, owns and operates a farm of rice to earn a living. For six years on the farm, she has earned well to support her child and their living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used on the farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase fertilizers and a new variety of seedlings. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and a new variety of seedlings

loans.name: Vicencia

texts.en:
Vicencia is 42 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school, Vicencia works very hard to provide for them.

Vicencia runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Vicencia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a chicken-selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now. 

She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of chicken to sell.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of chicken to sell.

loans.name: Poderosas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Poderosas está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su clima frió, por los 4 ríos que la bañan, por sus paisajes naturales y su arquitectura, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y su cultura, son personas amables y de un corazón cálido. Las socias laboran para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ximena, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito Ponderosas, fue invitada por la presidenta del grupo y espera que los créditos le ayuden a mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar.
La Señora Ximena tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre, aún no ha concebido hijos, su esposo se dedica al negocio ambulante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Ximena se dedica al comercio informal, vende lasos, vinchas, moños, etc. lleva 4 años en el negocio y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también se dedica la venta de una gran variedad de cosméticos. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de vinchas y cosméticos para tener variedad. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Poderosa” loan group is made up of seven ladies who live in the city of Cuenca, known for its cold climate, its four rivers that bathe it, for its natural landscape and architecture.  It’s been a World Heritage site since December 1999.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions and are friendly people with warm hearts.  These members work for the stability of their household and to provide their children with a better future.

Ximena is one of the members and she is asking for her first loan, along with her friends from the Poderosa loan group.  She was invited to join by the group’s president and expects the loans to help her improve the stability of her household.

Ximena is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and doesn’t have any children.  Her husband is a mobile vendor and they live in a rented house.

Ximena is an informal merchant and sells laces, headbands, bows, etc. and has been doing so for four years.  She works seven days a week with no set schedule.  She also sells a large variety of cosmetics.

She will use the money from this loan to buy headbands and cosmetics so that she will have a variety in stock.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and headbands.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina works hard to support her family. Rufina is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines. Rufina has been in this business for 15 years now.

Rufina requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wax, treads, etc.

In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wax, treads, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gemma requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 40 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom are in school.

Johna is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Johna has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Johna requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

In the future, Johna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Predismenda

texts.en:
Predismenda works hard to support her family. Predismenda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, eggs, noodles, milk, etc.

In the future, Predismenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, eggs, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 39 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, bread, etc..

Ailyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosenda is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosenda has a pig-raising business in the Philippines. Rosenda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosenda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucily

texts.en:
Lucily is 51 years old and married with one child who is in school. Lucily works very hard to provide for the family.

Lucily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, spices, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Lucily has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lucily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, spices, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en:
Brigilda is 51 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Brigilda works very hard to provide for them.

Brigilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like cream, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc.

Brigilda has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Brigilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like cream, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 54 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Maribeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribeth has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Enkhtungalag

texts.en:
Ms.Enkhtungalag is a bachelor degree student who studies in a public university as a land organizer. She is the first person in her family who is studying in the university, to get a higher education. 

Enkhtungalag is a very hard-working student and her short-term goal is to graduate successfully from her university and to get a job. She always wants to improve herself and this loan helps her to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Samba Gueye

texts.fr: Monsieur Samba est un tailleur de profession qui est marié et père de famille. Il a une expérience de plus de 7ans dans cette activité. Il demande ce crédit d’un montant de 300.000F pour acheter une machine à coudre et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.  Samba commence sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 20h. Ses charges principales sont les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il aimerait devenir un grand styliste et cela il ne le pourra faire qu’avec l’aide de l’institution. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Samba is a professional tailor, he is married and has children.  He has more than seven years' experience as a tailor.  He has requested this loan of 300,000 francs CFA, in order to buy a sewing machine to meet the demands of his customers.

Samba works from nine in the morning until eight at night.  He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family, and the school fees of his children. 

In the future, Samba would like to become an important designer and he can only do this with the help of the field partner.  If he can achieve this, he will be able to increase his income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Jelibeth

texts.en:
Jelibeth is 33 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelibeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business. 

In the future, Jelibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Raquel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future, Raquel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natalia ella tiene una relacion de unión libre y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

La socia Natalia es la que levanta la mano.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de refrigerios, negocio de venta de zapatillas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “NUEVA LUZ II” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Natalia is in a common law marriage.  She is 39 years old and has two children.  She sells food such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat dishes, and works from 10:00 pm to 5:00 pm.  She has had this business for seven years and things are going very well.  She wants to have her own restaurant someday.  She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, meats, and vegetables.

Natalia is raising her hand.

The other members sell cold items, shoes, food, or have grocery stores.

She is grateful for those who form part of this dream and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nueva Ilusión está formado por 8 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar es privilegiado por sus tierras fértiles, su clima es frió y su geografía es accidentada con hermosos paisajes. Su gente es amable y gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y tiene una variada gastronomía. Las socia tienen un objetivo en común el cual es sacar adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nancy, forma parte activamente del grupo de crédito Nueva Ilusión, este es su tercer crédito que realiza y todo este tiempo ha podido mejorar la economía de su hogar e incrementar su negocio.
La Señora Nancy tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.
Doña Nancy pasa en casa al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos, pero ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de animales, tiene ganado, cuyes y pollos, también labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión credit group is made up of eight women and one man who live in the outskirts of the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. This area is privileged to have fertile lands, a cool climate and a location surrounded by beautiful landscapes. The people here are friendly and welcoming. They continue to maintain their people's culture and traditions and have a wide variety of foods. The members of the group have a common goal of moving their families forward. 

One of the members of this group is Nancy who takes an active part in the Nueva Ilusión credit group. This is her third cycle and she has been able to improve her home's economic situation and expand her business with this time. Nancy is 26 years old and married. She has three children from this civil union who are seven, four and three years old. Her oldest two children are enrolled in the local elementary school. Nancy's husband works in construction and they live in a rental because they do not own their own home. 

Nancy spends her time at home caring for her small children. However, in order to help her husband the household expenses, she raises animals including livestock, guinea pigs and chickens. She also works in agriculture, selling what she harvests within her community and in the city. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 64 years old and married, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Carmelita has been in this business for nine years and she sells a variety of items, such as cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, noodles, and bread. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Helconida

texts.en:
Helconida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle rental business.

Helconida has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Helconida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco-vending business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from food-vending. Cristina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 20 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Dulce has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Dulce has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Panfila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional gear and tools for her fishing business.

Panfila has been in this business for 30 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gear and tools for her fishing business.

loans.name: Guerison Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kabuo est une commerçante d’une expérience de 20 ans, âgée de 59 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Guérison ». Elle est vendeuse de viande/vache (Boucherie). Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 quartiers de viande. Son conjoint est vendeur d’eau dans les périphéries de la ville (Borne fontaine). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire sa maison, scolariser et nourrir tous ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kabuo, is a merchant with twenty years of experience. She is 59 years old and a mother of eight children, all students. She is a member of a business association "Guérison". Her husband is a water vendor in the outskirts of the city (Borne Fontaine). Kabuo is a vendor of meat/cattle (butcher). She started her business with funds from her husband and is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She is going to purchase 2 quarters of meat. For the future, Kabuo would like to build her own house, provide education to her children, and feed them. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them loans during this time of conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mwaka est une commerçante depuis 10 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Chance », âgée de 32 ans et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient  et 2 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse de braise et de farine de manioc. Elle étale ses activités dans un dépôt du marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 10 sacs de braise et 5 sacs de manioc.  Son conjoint est un militaire de l’armée loyaliste. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de sa maman. Dans l’avenir, elle compte faire l’élevage pour sa famille, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il seid de signaler quelques clientes portent leurs bebes.
texts.en:
This client, Mwaka, has been a merchant for ten years and a  member of a business association "Chance". She is 32 years old and a mother of four children, of whom two are students and two others are still very young. Her husband is a soldier in the loyalist army. Mwaka is a vendor of charcoal  and cassava flour. She started her business with funds from her mother. She is setting up her business in a warehouse at the city market and is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She is going to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and 5 sacks of cassava. 

For the future, Mwaka plans on raising livestock. For her family and children, she plans on providing education, clothing, and food. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them loans during this time of conflict in the country's east. It should be noted that a few of the clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and cassava

loans.name: Archil Lorelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Archil Lorelie works hard to support her family.
