The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of garlic, pepper, laurel and other seasonings to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Rabeel Group

texts.en: Rabeel, a 25-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons and 1 daughter, all of whom are studying.  Her husband is an auto-mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs.  So, Rabeel is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine.  She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.  Rabeel is a member of a three-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally.  She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.es: Doña Calixta es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 51 años de edad. Casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace muchos años, con poca cantidad de productos, y que a pesar de eso, poco a poco las ventas iban creciendo y las demandas de clientes también. Luego decide comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio. Ahora, cuenta con su pulpería que la beneficia para asumir los gastos de su familia. Su meta próxima es surtir su mercadería y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para comprar: café instantáneo, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, jabón, frijoles, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes que la visitan. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias para comprar una vitrina y así exhibir algunos productos. Su plan futuro es apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Calixta is a 51 year old native of the city of Boaco.  She is married and has two children.  She is a businesswoman and has a small general store.  She started this business many years ago with a small select of products, but little by little, her sales began to grow as did her customers' demand.  She later decided to purchase more merchandise to stock the business.  Now, her store allows her to cover her family's expenses.  Her goal is to fully supply her merchandise and improve her living conditions.

She is seeking a loan to purchase instant coffee, soda, rice, sugar, soap, beans, and other items, with the goal of offering a greater variety of products to her customers.  She believes that the loan with be helpful because she will be able to bring in higher earnings to purchase a display case to exhibit some products.  Her plan for the future is to support her children's educations.

loans.use: purchase instant coffee, soda, rice, sugar, soap, beans and other items.

loans.name: Kholmurod

texts.ru: Холмурод пожилой мужчина в возрасте 70 лет. Проживает он в районе Хамадони с женой и пятерьмя детьми. Все его дети взрослые и живут своей жизнью. Холмурод имеет среднее техническое образование. В данный момент он находится на пенсии и нигде не работает. На старости лет он решил открыть собственный бизнес, которым будет заниматься при дворе своего дома. Холмурод планирует выращивать крупнорогатый скот для дальнейшей продажи. У него имеется старый сарай для содержания скота, а также сбережение в размере 2000 таджикских сомони. Холмурод просит кредит недостающую сумму в размере 850 долларов. На сумму собственного сбережения и кредита Холмурод хочет закупить коров и бычков, а также корм. Благодаря кредиту у него будет новый источник дохода.
texts.en:
Kholmurod is an elderly, 70-year-old man. He lives in Hamadoni with his wife and five children. His children are grown up and have their own lives. Kholmurod has a secondary technical education. Currently, he is retired and does not have a job. However, in his old age he decided to start his own business, which he can take care of in his own backyard. 

Kholmurod plans to grow and then sell large horned cattle. He has an old barn in which to keep the cattle, as well as a savings of 2000 somoni. Kholmurod is requesting a loan of $850 USD, the remaining sum needed. With his savings and microloan, Kholmurod wants to buy cows and bulls, as well as feed. Thanks to the loan, Kholmurod will have a new source of income.

loans.use: To buy large horned cattle for resale

loans.name: María Tereza

texts.es:
María es una mujer ejemplar de profesión maestra de educación primaria, actualmente se desempeña como bibliotecaria en un colegio de la localidad donde vive, se  ha destacado por la atención y apoyo que le brinda a los estudiantes, es casada con 1 hijo al que está apoyando para sus estudios técnicos, su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería como otra alternativa económica, 
Esta señora quiere mejorar su vivienda por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar un Repello a las paredes, ya que el mismo lo utilizara en la  
 Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, piedrín, arena y mano de obra, el que le vendría a dar mejores condiciones  a su familia.
texts.en:
María is an exemplary woman. She is a trained primary school teacher. She currently works as a librarian at a school in the town where she lives. She stands out at work due to the attention and support she offers to the students. She is married with one child, whom she is supporting in his technical studies. Her husband has a small cabinetmaking workshop as an extra source of income.

She would like to make improvements to her home, so she came to Ceprodel to apply for financing. She will plaster the walls and buy construction materials such as cement, gravel, and sand, as well as paying workers. This will help her give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, gravel, and sand, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana continua dedicándose a la venta de carne de pollo, a la venta productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y esta implementada con la necesidades básicas, ella a tiende a sus vecinos y amigos con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Juana nació en la ciudad de Puno pero ahora vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos a quienes saca adelante,
texts.en:
Juana continues to sell poultry (chicken) and primary need items such as rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables.  She has a small stall in one of the markets in the city of Paucartambo, where she sells her products.  It is set up with the basic requirements and she serves her friends and neighbors with much friendliness and courtesy, so they always return to buy from her.

She has been doing this for several years and things are going very well for her because of the effort she puts into her work.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she is asking for a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar and to increase her working capital.  She is grateful and values this loan and is committed to making her payments responsibly and on time.

Juana was born in Puno but now lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo, within the Cusco department.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children whom she gets ahead.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиер 1992 года рождения. Учится в Институт Финансов и Экономики, на третьем  курсе, в факультете налоги и налогаоблажение. Он не женат, живет с родителями.
 Бахтиер учится хорошо, очень положительный человек. Добропорядочный, скромный и спокойный, довольно общительный. Он является старшим ребенком в семье. Отец работает поваром, мать домохозяйка. Несмотря на то, что он учится он ещё и работает мастером по ремонту техники. Бахтиёр запрашивает займ на сумму 750 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor was born in 1992 and is a third year student at the Finance and Economics Institute of Tajikistan, studying taxes and taxation. He is unmarried and is living with his parents.

Bakhtiyor is a good student and a positive person. He is well-mannered, modest, laid-back, and sociable. Bakhtiyor is the oldest child in his family; his father is a cook and his mother is a homemaker. In addition to his studies, Bakhtiyor works as a technical repairman. Bakhtiyor is requesting a loan of $750 USD in order to pay his tuition; he appreciates your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 33 years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Jesulome 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESULOME 1 est composé de dix-sept personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Blandine (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) âgée de 53 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Blandine est mariée à un maçon nommé Léon. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Blandine vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis douze ans. De façon secondaire, Blandine vend du maïs. Blandine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Blandine ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESULOME 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The JESULOME 1 group is made up of seventeen people who are friends and live in the same village. The group's representative is Blandine (raising her hand in the photo), who is 53 years old and did not go to school. 

In hopes of taking their businesses to the next level in order to better meet customer demand, the group is seeking financial support from Alidé for the first time. 

Blandine is married to a mason named Léon. The couple has two children, one of whom goes to school, and both of whom they support. Blandine lives together with her husband and their children. 

The couple provides for their household expenses together. In order to do this, Blandine has been selling food from her home for twelve years. On the side, she also sells corn. Blandine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of expanding her business and satisfying her customers, Blandine has come together with the other members of the JESULOME 1 group to seek their first loan through Alidé.

loans.use: to buy condiments and corn.

loans.name: Barotgul

texts.ru:
Баротгул жительница района Шахритус. Ей 50 лет. Она продавщица и начала свою торговую деятельность недавно. Около 1,2 года как Баротгул продает на рынке хлебобулочные изделия. 
Баротгул замужем, имеет сына и дочь. Ее муж находится на заработках за пределами страны. Дочь Баротгул помогает матери в торговле. Сейчас Баротгул хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара. Она просит кредит для покупки хлебобулочных изделий с целью развития торговли. 
Баротгул в будущем хочет построить магазин и расшить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Barotgul lives in Shahrituz. She is 50 years old. She recently started working as a saleswoman. Barotgul has been selling baked goods for a year or two. 

Barotgul is married; she has a son and a daughter. Her husband is working abroad. Barotgul's daughter helps her mother trade. Barotgul now wants to increase her product range. She is requesting a loan to purchase baked goods and increase sales. In the future, Barotgul wants to build a store and expand her business.

loans.use: buy baked goods to sell

loans.name: German

texts.es: German de 50 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía del hogar. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja muy duro para darles cada día mejores condiciones de vida. German se dedica al cultivo y venta de variedad de hortalizas y verduras tales como: güisquil, ejotes, cilantro, espinaca, perejil y mora.  Con el fin de dar mayor seguridad a su familia ha tomado la decisión de reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que en la actualidad se encuentra deteriorado. Además, desea construir una canaleta para la salida de las aguas lluvias para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera y cemento para reparar el techo y para construir la canaleta.
texts.en:
German is fifty years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their two adult children, who are now contributing to the household economy. His family is the most important thing to him and he works very hard to improve their living conditions. 

German works farming and selling a variety of vegetables and herbs like pear squash, green beans, spinach, cilantro, parsley, and black nightshade. In order to provide more safety for his family he has decided to repair the roof of their home, because it is currently in disrepair. He also wants to build a gutter for rain water to flow. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase corrugated sheet metal, wood, and cement to repair the roof and build the gutter.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and cement to repair his roof and build a gutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food staples in order to stock his store and offer his customers a greater variety.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old and he is married with four children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production

loans.name: Hermogena

texts.en:
Hermogena is 57 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Hermogena works very hard to provide for them.

Hermogena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. 

Hermogena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nuevo Bankito La Ramada  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevo Bankito la Ramada está formado por 13 mujeres quienes aún guardan sus tradiciones y la cultura de sus pueblos, laboran en la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad, siempre con el afán de mejorar su situación económica. Viven en Nabon que es un cantón que tiene clima frió, se encuentra rodeado de mucha vegetación por su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Flavia, forma parte desde hace 3 años del grupo de crédito Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, todo este tiempo los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su actividad económica.
La Señora Flavia tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes son gemelos y tienen 2 años de edad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Flavia se dedica a los trabajos tradicionales de su sector que lo aprendido de sus padres, cría gallinas, cuyes y cerdos, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha  lo vende en su comunidad y en la ciudad, le gusta trabajar en este negocio ya que pasa en casa y así cuida de sus pequeños hijos. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de abonos, semillas y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es crecer más en este negocio.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Bankito la Ramada loan group is made up of 13 ladies who maintain their people’s culture and traditions and work as farmers and raise livestock.  Many of them work in the city and always with the goal of improving their financial situation.  They live in Nabon, which is a settlement with a cold climate, surrounded by lots of vegetation in a staggered landscape.  It’s architecture is a mix of modern and antique.

Flavia is one of the members and she has been with the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada group for three years and the loans have helped her grow her business during all this time.

Flavia is 34 years old and the single mother of a set of two year old twins.  She owns her home. 

Flavia does traditional work in her area, which she learned from her parents.  She raises chickens, Guinea pigs, pigs, and also farms.  She sells her harvests in the community and in the city and enjoys working in this business that allows her to stay home and care for her little children.

She will use the money from this loan to buy compost, seeds, and feed for her animals.  Her goal is to grow her business more.

loans.use: to buy seeds and animal feed.

loans.name: Mustafoqul

texts.ru:
Мустафокул 60 летний продавец продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 11 лет. Мустафокулу нравится его работа, нравится общаться с новыми людьми и помогать им с выбором продуктов. Работе ему помогает его сыновья. Они работают строителями, но всегда найдут время помочь отцу. Мустафокул не отказывается от помощи, но в основном сам продвигает свою деятельность.
   Мустафокул, чтобы увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара и привлечь больше клиентов решил за счет кредита купить новый товар. Он пополнить опустевшие полки и привезет новые продукты. Он просит $2500 с надеждой, что вы ему поможете.
texts.en:
Mustafoqul is a 60-year-old grocer. He has been doing this work for more than eleven years. Mustafoqul likes his job. He likes to talk to new people and help them choose products. His sons help him with his work. They work in construction, but always find time to help their father. Mustafoqul doesn't refuse their help, but he does most of the work himself. 

In order to increase his inventory and attract more customers, Mustafoqul decided to take out a loan to buy new products. He will replenish his empty shelves and bring in new products. He is asking for $2500 and hopes that you'll help him.
.

loans.use: increase his sales inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old.

Jenefer has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods like candies, chocolates, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

In the future, Jenefer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like candies, chocolates, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Juhudi Kilimo

texts.en:
Juhudi Kilimo is a microfinance organization, and a current Kiva field partner. Founded in 2009, they provide micro-asset financing for farmers, administering loans for the purchase of dairy cows, chickens, and irrigation equipment. 

Juhudi would like to design, pilot, and scale a clean energy loan program so that they can begin to offer solar lighting, cook stove, and water loans to over 100,000 rural farmers over the next five years. In order to do this, they are working with MicroEnergy Credits (MEC), a for-profit social enterprise based in the US that works with financial institutions to set up and scale clean energy programs.

MEC and Juhudi are requesting a loan of $50,000 USD from Kiva lenders to help pay for the up-front costs of designing a loan program for clean energy that will eventually serve 100,000 rural farmers. The loan will help fund ⅓ of the costs that MEC will incur in supporting Juhudi Kilimo, and specifically it will go to pay for the following program areas:
	
•	Hiring a program manager who will help perform market research, business planning, financial product design, pilot implementation, course correction, and scale-up of the clean energy lending program. The program manager will facilitate supplier relationships and ensure the data collection systems are in place to capture carbon revenue. 
	
•	Setting up “Carbon Tracker”: MicroEnergy Credits has developed carbon offset data management software called Carbon Tracker that enables an MFI to track clean energy product sales and delivery. This database is used to generate investment-grade carbon offsets and plays an integral role in after-sales services and monitoring. Part of this loan will be used set up Juhudi Kilimo with this software.

•	Establishing a carbon offset program at Juhudi Kilimo: MicroEnergy Credits facilitates the carbon origination, validation, and purchase agreements for the offsets generated by the MFIs clean energy loans. The up-front costs of this will be partially covered by this loan.

•	Hiring MicroEnergy Officers (MEO): MEOs are front-line staff who will be placed at the branches within Juhudi Kilimo, and are providing clean energy marketing, last-mile distribution, and after-sales and warranty support.
		
Juhudi Kilimo and MicroEnergy Credits seek Kiva funding to design, pilot, and scale a sustainable clean energy program to empower rural farmers with access to efficient cook stoves, solar lighting, water filters and biogas digesters.  

Millions of families and small businesses around the world use outdated technology to light and warm their homes, cook their food, and clean their drinking water. The majority of rural Kenyans use inefficient stoves for cooking that use wood or charcoal for fuel, but these stoves produce harmful emissions and have a significant detrimental effect on health. Similarly, many rural Kenyans are not connected to the electricity grid and rely on kerosene lanterns for light, however these technologies produce emissions that are harmful to the users' health. 

Three main barriers exist that prevent the poor from upgrading to newer, cleaner, more efficient technologies:	

•	Poor distribution: poor infrastructure and low population density inhibit clean energy supplier outreach. 	
•	Lack of marketing: rural farmers have limited access to markets and information about new products. In many instances,  
        purchasing a new product requires a clear explanation of the value proposition. 
•	Access to finance: many clean energy technologies are only affordable through credit mechanisms.

This loan will help Juhudi Kilimo, with the assistance and technical support of MEC, to address these barriers by connecting Juhudi to clean energy suppliers and carbon finance.

This loan will be repaid by MEC on behalf of Juhudi Kilimo with carbon offset revenues, and also by the margin that MEC will earn from purchasing technologies from clean energy suppliers. Loan repayments will come from MEC’s profits.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Juhudi Kilimo from Kenya

loans.use: To pay for the up-front costs of designing a loan program for clean energy

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru:
Отабек занимается растениеводством вот уже 3 года. Во дворе своего дома он имеет 6 маленьких теплиц и в данный момент он выращивает в них лимон для продажи. Отабек продолжает ремесло своего отца и научился этому делу у него. Отабеку 43 года, он женат. У него есть сын и дочь. Его жена портниха. Она шьет на заказ женские национальные платья. Отабек параллельно с растениеводством работает еще и мужским парикмахером. Он разносторонний человек и успевает во всем. 
Сейчас Отбаек нуждается в кредите. Он хочет провести  ремонт в теплице и закупить минеральные удобрения для урожая лимона. Для этой цели он просит кредит. Отабек имеет большие планы на будущее. В будущем году он планирует построить еще две теплицы для выращивания весеннего помидора.
texts.en:
Otabek has been farming for three years. In his front yard he has six small greenhouses where he grows lemons to sell. This was Otabek's father's profession, and he learned the business from him. Otabek is 43 years old. He is married. He has a son and a daughter. His wife is a dressmaker. She sews traditional women's dresses to order. Otabek works as both a farmer and a barber. He is a well-rounded person who succeeds at everything. 

Now Otabek needs a loan. He wants repair a greenhouse and buy fertilizer for his lemon crop. So he is asking for a loan. Otabek has big plans for the future. In the future, he plans to build two greenhouses to grow tomatoes in the spring.

loans.use: repair his greenhouses and buy fertilizer for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Masharif

texts.ru:
Машариф много лет своей жизни посвятил деятельности скотоводства. Он с самого начала своего бизнеса относился к работе серьезно и ответственно. Машариф простой пастух из города Кулоб. Всю свою жизнь он работал во благо своих семьи, ради родителей, жены, детей. Машариф верующий и честный мужчина. Он работает на скотном дворе уже много лет. Во многих областях Таджикистана для населения основным видом деятельности является животноводство и растениеводства. Машариф в их числе тоже активно занимается животноводством. 
   Наступила зима и Машариф уже успел разместить скотов в коровнике. Он решил увеличить поголовья скота с целью расширения своего малого бизнеса. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить пару голов скота и корм для них. Машариф скорее спешит запастись сеном и другими видами корма для своих скотов. Машариф надеется, что вы ему обязательно поможете. Он ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Masharif has dedicated many years of his life to keeping livestock. From the very beginning of his business, his attitude was such that he worked seriously and responsibly. Masharif is a simple shepherd in Kulob. For his entire life he has worked for the benefit of his family, parents, wife, and children. Masharif is a faithful and honest man. He has worked in a barnyard for many years. In many areas, most Tajiks work primarily farming and keeping livestock. Masharif is among them--he is actively involved in animal husbandry. 

Winter came, and Masharif already managed to put his cattle up in the barn. He decided to increase the number of livestock he has in order to expand his small business. He is asking for a loan to buy a couple head of cattle and food for them. Masharif is in rather a hurry to stock up on hay and other types of feed for his cattle. Masharif hopes that you will help him. He's awaiting your help!

loans.use: buy a couple head of cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru:
Чахонгир житель района Гиссар. Он в этом районе родился, вырос и работает. Чахонгир живет с родителями. Он не женат и не имеет детей. Чахонгир работает водителем такси. Такую деятельность он освоил не так давно. 2 года назад он получил права и стал предоставлять жителям района услугу такси. Чахонгиру 20 лет. У него нет высшего образования. По обстоятельствам он был вынужден работать. Для него такая работа единственный источник дохода. 
   Сейчас машина Чахонгира сломана и не пригодна для работы. Чахангир остро нуждается в кредите, чтобы отремонтировать машину. Он надеется на Вашу помощь. И верит, что скоро он отремонтирует машину и вернется к работе.
texts.en:
Jahongir lives in Gissar. He was born in the area, grew up there, and now works there. Jahongir lives with his parents. He is not married and has no children. Jahongir works as a taxi driver. He only recently learned this profession. Two years ago he got a license and started providing locals with taxi service. Jahongir is twenty years old. He does not have a higher education. He had to start working because of his circumstances. This is his only source of income. 

Now Jahongir's car is broken down. Jahongir is in dire need of a loan to repair the car. He is hoping for your help. He has faith that soon he will be able to repair the car and return to work.

loans.use: repair his car so he can drive his taxi.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela continua dedicandose a la venta de abarrotes como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, pan, gaseosas, cigarros, cerveza, chocolates, conservas y   otras cosas más, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz , fideos, conservas y otras, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.

Ella nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y le encanta vivir en esta ciudad pues sus padres también vivieron allí, ella tiene 55 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella
texts.en:
Estela continues to sell groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, bread, soft drinks, cigarettes, beer, chocolates, preserves, and other things.  She has been a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank for several years and needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar and rice, noodles, preserves, and other things.  She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments responsibly and on time.

She was born in the city of Paucartambo and she likes living in this city because her parents also lived there.  She is 55 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has seven children.  She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial mother who gets her family ahead through her hard work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, noodles, canned food, and more

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es: Luis tiene 36 años de edad y vive junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad en casa propia. Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de albañilería y ahora en día es lo que le permite ganarse el sustento diario ya que gracias a su talento y delicadeza en el trabajo muchas personas buscan sus servicios. Su esposa se ocupa de las actividades domésticas del hogar por lo que no recibe ingreso alguno. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda y poco a poco la va mejorando. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño que actualmente lo tiene cubierto con una cortina y además, desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Luis is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their little daughter, who is seven years old. Ever since he was very  young, he learned construction work and currently that is what allows him to make a living because thanks to his talent and attention to detail, many people seek his services. His wife works as a homemaker, so she doesn't earn any income. Through much effort, he has managed to build his home and keeps improving it little by little. 

He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a bathroom which is currently concealed by a curtain. He also wants to plaster the walls of his home. He will use the loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron. He states that he has the repayment ability that this loan entails.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron to build a bathroom and plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Ana Pastora

texts.es:
Ana es una joven señora que se desempeña como técnico municipal de educación del mined de la localidad donde vive con 3 años de servicio, es casada  con 2 hijos a su cargo, hoy en día  tiene la urgencia de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, solo atravez del financiamiento lo puede lograr, por eso llego a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar crédito el que lo utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, cemento, bloques y mano de obra.
Con los cuales construiría  un cuarto para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en: Ana is a young lady who works as a municipal education technician in her area.  She has been doing this for three years, is married, and has two children.  She desperately needs to make improvements to her home and will only be able to do it with a loan, so she came to the CEPRODEL office to request one, which she will use to buy building materials such as iron bars, cement, cinder blocks and pay for labor to build another room to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Josefa es una mujer preocupada por el bienestar de su familia es casada con 1 hijo a su cargo de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 13 años de laborar, actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por lo que se acerco a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el que utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: Bloques , Cemento, Arena, Hierro y Mano de Obra, para realizar la obra en la construcción de pared y mejorar las condiciones de su familia
texts.en: Josefa is a woman concerned about her family’s wellbeing.  She is married and has a son who depends on her.  [Josefa] has been working as an elementary school teacher for 13 years and needs to make improvements to her house, so she approached CEPRODEL to request a loan, which she will use to buy building materials such as cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron bars, and pay for labor to build a wall and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Cerrito Group

texts.en:
The members of the group Mujeres del Cerrito live in the small town of San Lorenzo near the city of Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  All seven of them work selling food products such as fruits, vegetables, snacks and tortillas.  They are very happy to be part of the Namaste Foundation’s program as they will receive financial training and business advice in addition to getting a loan.

Maria (1st from right) is 65 years old and married with four grown children living elsewhere.  She also has one teenager who has left school to work with his father on the rubber plantation.  She is illiterate.  She and her family live in very humble circumstances, in a small house without running water or electricity on the edge of the rubber plantation where her husband works full time.  He gets paid twice a month at which time he gives her money for household expenses.  She then invests part of this money to buy products to sell to the workers when they pass by her house.  She would like to have a little storefront under a thatched roof at the front of her house and be able to sell products every day instead of only twice a month.  Her dream is to make enough money to improve the family’s living conditions.
She currently has monthly profits of 474 Guatemalan Quetzales (US $60), as she only has products to sell twice a month.  She wants to invest her loan money in buying more products so that she can sell food and drinks on a daily basis.  Her goal is to increase her profits by 46% to earn at least 692 Quetzales (US $87) per month.

loans.use: to buy more stock so she can sell more food and drinks to workers walking by her house

location.town: Canton El Cerrito, San Lorenzo, Suchitepequez

loans.name: Jeyny Lissett

texts.es: Jeyny es una señora dedicada a impartir el pan de la enseñanza, ya que su profesión es maestra de educación primaria y actualmente es la subdirectora del colegio donde labora, es madre soltera con 2 hijos bajo su  responsabilidad, esta señora a  visitado a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y realizar las mejoras a su vivienda ya que es uno de los sueños más anhelado ya que el mismo lo utilizara en la Compra de Materiales de Construcción como: Lavandero, bloques decorados, arena, pintura, toma corriente, cemento, apagadores sencillos, lámpara de 40 Watt, Gibson, alambre eléctrico, ´puertas y mano de obra, los que le vendrán a dar las condiciones básicas a su familia
texts.en:
In her job as a primary school teacher, Jeyny is dedicated to her role of sharing knowledge with her students. Currently she is deputy director of the school where she teaches. She is a single mother with two children. 

Jeyny has approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan to make improvements to her house, a dream she has long wished to be fulfilled. She will use the money to buy construction materials such as a laundry sink, decorative blocks, sand, paint, electric power points, cement, simple switches, 40 watt bulb, cable, doors, and labour. In this way her family’s standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: buy construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Matilde Del Socorro

texts.es:
Matilde es una señora con visión de futuro en cuanto al mejoramiento de los niveles de vida, es casada no tiene hijo a su cargo, es maestra de educación primaria con 23 años de laborar, quiere ampliar su vivienda lo que le hizo tomar la decisión de visitar ceprodel para solicitar crédito el que utilizaría en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, arena, piedrín, hierro y mano de obra.
El que le permitiría realizar la obra que desea como es la construcción de un cuarto y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Matilde has a vision of the future in which her standard of living is much improved. She is married but doesn’t have any children to raise. She has been a primary school teacher for 23 years.

Now Matilde wishes to enlarge her house. She decided to approach Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, sand, gravel, reinforcing iron, and labour. These supplies will enable her to add an extra room and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy construction supplies to build an extra room on her house

loans.name: Milka's Group

texts.en:
Milka is a member of Buruburu Group in Matete District.  She is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 97 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Milka has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	

Milka is married and has 2 children.  She is 35 years old and is known for being hardworking and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Milka has been a farmer for 7 years.  Milka described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
  							
Milka first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2006 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Milka joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers.  Milka plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Milka’s own life was improved because she was able to feed the family.

Milka and the Buruburu Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed for his business.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 48 years old. He is a father of five children. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua comprando y vendiendo condimentos, granos secos, papa, cereales entonces envía sus productos a las revendedoras de uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos secos como por ejemplo cebada,  maíz y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Manuela is grateful to lenders for their continued support, and she plans to use the support from this loan to purchase dry grains, potatoes, cereals and other items to stock her business. She sells these and other products in the central market in Cusco, and she hopes to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry grains, such as barley, corn and other staples foods.

loans.name: Chantale Elisabeth

texts.fr: Chantale est une femme de 50 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 et 27 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate)  dans un marché de la place depuis 18 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de cajots de tomate ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Chantale is a 50-year-old woman who is a married mother of eight children, from 6 to 27 years old. She is a merchant and has been selling fresh staple items (tomatoes) at a local market for eighteen years. She is very familiar with suppliers, especially her customers, whom she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. But she finds herself constantly short of inventory because she is compelled to sell her entire inventory in order to procure more. This is due to her meager capital. 

Chantale would like to increase her stock of tomatoes in crates, enabling her to satisfy better her customers' constant demand and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Verónica María

texts.es:
Verónica es una señora con mucho deseo de superación en la vida personal de luchar por alcanzar el sueño deseado de tener su propia vivienda, es casada con 1 hijo a su cargo al que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, de profesión maestra de educación primaria del cual tiene 16 años de laborar.
Esta señora tiene la urgencia de completar la compra de un lote de terreno donde será en el futuro su casa de habitación propia. Por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el sueño deseado ya que el mismo lo utilizara en el Completamiento de pago de terreno y formalización de Escrituración, el que atravez del  apoyo del crédito lo hará posible y mejorar los niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Veronica is a woman with a great desire to succeed in her personal life and she works to achieve her dream of owning her own house.  She is married and has a son whom she cares for and she gives him all the support he needs for his development.  She is an elementary school teacher and has been doing this for 16 years.

This woman is married and she wants to buy a lot on which to build her house in the future.  She visited CEPRODEL to request a loan and will use the money to pay for land and a deed.   The loan will make this possible and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land a pay for a deed.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una señora entregada por completo al cuido y desarrollo de su familia, es viuda ya no tiene hijos a su cargo, ella labora como conserje en un centro de  salud donde vive con 26 años de servicios.
Esta señora presenta la necesidad de construir una cocina la que tiene en mal estado, por eso visito las oficinas de  ceprodel  para solicitar financiamiento para la Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, zinc, perlin, arena, bloques y mano de obra.
Y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Francisca  is a woman completely dedicated to the caring and development of her family.  She is a widow, doesn’t have any children and has worked as a counselor at a health center for 26 years.  This lady needs to build a kitchen because hers in in poor state, so she visited the CEPRODEL office to request a loan to buy building materials, such as cement, zinc metal, metal bars, sand, cinder blocks, and pay for labor.  This way she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nelson José

texts.es: Nelson es un señor que por  generaciones a impartido clases a niños y adolescentes, ya que su profesión es maestro de educación primaria y secundaria con 29 años de servicio en diferentes colegios de la zona, este señor tiene la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda, atravez de financiamiento lo que visito a ceprodel para tener la oportunidad de realizar la obra que tanto la necesita, ya que el mismo  lo utilizara en la Compra de materiales de construcción como: hierro, cemento, piedrín, arena, alambre de amarre y mano de obra, para Reconstruir los pilares y la pared y de esa manera darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is a man who has been teaching generations of children and teens.  He is a middle school teacher and has been doing this in different schools in the area for 29 years.  This man needs to make improvements to his house, so he visited CEPRODEL to request a loan that will allow him to do this work that he desperately needs.  He will use the money to buy iron bars, cement, pebbles, sand, bailing wire, and pay for labor to rebuild the pillars and a wall and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Light Bank Group

texts.es: Mariela, quien en la fotografía aparece sentada en medio de dos hombres, pertenece al Banco Comunal Light Bank que queda en la comuna de Cañete, en donde sus socios tienen distintos negocios tales como chocolatería, venta de mariscos, ropa nueva, legumbres. La venta de empanadas, pasteles de choclo y humitas son el negocio de Mariela. Su negocio lo tiene hace casi 4 años, y lo comenzó a raíz de una grave enfermedad de su hijo mayor fue ayudada por un vecino quien le regalo un horno industrial para hacer empanadas y un poco de dinero. La empresa es familiar, y los desafíos que tiene es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar sus carreras.  El préstamo que solicitará es para poder comprar más insumos para sus empanadas carne, harina bolsas en donde entrega las empanadas, servilletas, y además para comprar choclos para el pastel y las humitas. Espera que le vaya muy bien ya que tiene su clientela. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que para solicitar el préstamo no es necesario hacer grandes trámites.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Community Bank Light Bank, which is located in the community of Cañete. In the photo, Mariela is seated in the front row between two of her male colleagues. The various members of the group make a living in a variety of trades, including chocolate making and sales, seafood sales, clothing sales, vegetable sales, etc. Mariela makes a living selling homemade food dishes, including empanadas, corn cakes and other items. She started her business four years ago when her older brother became very ill and she needed to earn money to help with his medical expenses and treatment. Her's is a family business, and Mariela works very hard to support her children in their education and studies.

With the support from this loan, Mariela plans to purchase input items for making her food dishes, including meat, flour, corn, bags for packaging, napkins, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business, since she already has an established client base. Mariela has really enjoyed being a member of the Community Bank, and she is grateful for the opportunities she has received.

loans.use: to purchase input items for making her empanadas, corn cakes and other food dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Angela Romero

texts.es: Ángela de 53 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas  las cuales ya son mayores de edad  y le colaboran con la economía  del hogar. Ángela es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable quien todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para realizar la venta de variedad de ropa nueva la cual es muy demandada por sus clientes. Ángela desea terminar de construir un cerco perimetral ya que desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de tela metálica y así comenzar el cerco perimetral lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Angela is 53 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two adult children; they help with the household finances.  Angela is a hardworking, enterprising lady who travels along all of the main areas where she lives to sell a variety of new clothing, for which she has much customer demand.

Angela wants to build a perimeter fence because she wants to provide more security to her family.  She is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, in order to buy chain link fencing and begin building the fence as soon as possible.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Edwige Scholastique

texts.fr: Edwige est une jeune femme mariée, mère d'un enfant. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future
texts.en:
Edwige is a young married woman with one child. After her training, she opened a hair salon, which she has run for two years now. She often has a problem with a shortage of cosmetics, hair extensions and hair weaves in her salon because she buys her products retail. Her goal is to satisfy her customers and to earn a good profit.

Edwige is requesting this loan to buy her supplies in large quantities, which will allow her to achieve her goals. The profit she earns with this loan will help meet her and her child’s needs, as well as to increase her savings so she can grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions, hair weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es:
Dennis se dedica a la elaboración de productos derivados de la leche, como natilla, queso y también vende leche, sus clientes son locales y han acogido positivamente sus productos. Dennis  necesita renovar su ganado  para mantener la producción de leche, solicita ochocientos mil colones (¢800.000) dinero con el que comprará dos vacas para continuar 
con su actividad.
texts.en: Dennis makes dairy products such as custard, cheese, and also sells milk.  His customers are local and welcome his products.  Dennis needs to replenish his livestock in order to maintain his milk production.  He is asking for a loan of eight hundred-thousand Colones (¢800.000) so he can buy cows to continue his activities.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Daniel Alejandro

texts.es: Daniel de 21 años de edad habita junto a su madre y padre  en casa propia. Daniel es un joven trabajador que cada día se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su trabajo ubicado en una zona cercana a su localidad. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea apoyar a su familia en la mejora de la cubierta del techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra dañado. No cuenta con el capital disponible por lo que encontró la alternativa de solicitar este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera  y así poder dar inicio al cambio de techo lo antes posible. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
21-year old Daniel lives with his parents in their own house. He is a hardworking young man who gets up early every day to set out for work at a place near his home. The conditions in which he lives are very simple, and he wishes to help his family mend the roof of their house which has fallen into disrepair.

As he doesn’t have enough money of his own, Daniel has approached FUSAI to ask for a loan to buy galvanised sheets and wood so he can start the work as soon as possible. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheets and wood to repair the roof

loans.name: Arjanik

texts.en:
Arjanik is an agronomist from Margahovit village of Lori region. He lives with his parents, wife and daughter. His son currently serves in the army. Arjanik runs a small but profitable farm. He owns cows, pigs and oxen. Arjanik also owns a small plot of land where he cultivates potatoes and other vegetables. Arjanik takes the gathered harvest to the nearby open market and sells to local re-sellers.

Arjanik works hard to give his family appropriate living conditions. He currently is asking for a loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase forage and feed the livestock. Taking into consideration the current financial difficulties that Arjanik faces, the loan will be a huge support for him. The farming business is very important for him and Arjanik hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa has been running a general store for seven years, making a good earning for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to improve her offerings, and it was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
This is Ma. Fe, 30-years-old, and resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joe Mark, her business partner, and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for her everyday expenses.

Ma. Fe operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different products such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking.

Ma. Fe hopes to be successful in business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kakule est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Mufariji », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 38 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui 5 étudient et 1 autre est encore gosse. La cliente est une vendeuse de farine de maïs. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 6 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Kakule, is a shopkeeper and a member of the "Mufariji" business group.

This dynamic entrepreneur is 38 years old and is the mother of six children. Five of her children go to school, but one is too young. 

The client sells corn flour. She sells her goods in front of her home where she knows how to find her clients.

She initially started her business with her husband's capital. Her spouse is a teacher in a local school. Later on, she received a loan from l’IMF Hekima. She has been running her business for eight years. She will use this new loan to buy six bags of cassava flour.  She would like to buy a house and to educate and feed her children. 

She strongly thanks Hekima for the empowerment of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system - especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy six bags of cassava flour.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 37-years-old.  She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during maize production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic has a live-in partner and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for sixteen years now.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Hasil

texts.en:
Hasil is 49-years-old and lives in the Sabirabad region.  He is married and has three children.  For the past fifteen years, Hasil has been working hard to manage his clothing shop.

To help expand his  business, Hasil has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN from Aqroinvest CU. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Hasil to generate greater profits and take care of his family’s basic needs.  Hasil hopes that in the future he will be able to increase the stock in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza helped her husband earning a living by managing their own farm of corn while her husband does business in town. For five years in running this farm, Aiza made a good living, so she was able to provide for the needs of the family, especially her two children. 

She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to boost her farm. 

She is hopeful to gain more profit during this season, and use it for their needs. She wants to live better in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is 30 years old; he is married to a farmer. He has spent seven years in the business. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family; she is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has had this business for two years.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 53-years-old and has one child who is still in school.

Mary Ann has a sand and gravel business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of sand and gravel to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: M. Shafique

texts.en:
M. Shafique, aged forty, is an energetic man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He has been doing this business for many years and getting a reasonable income for his family.  He is responsible for his children, siblings and old parents.  His father has grown old and does not do any job.  His uses all efforts to provide comfort to his parents and younger brothers.

He is a milkman by profession.  He sells milk and bull calf to the butcher.  He has few buffalo; he gets milk two times in a day. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door.  For delivery purposes, he uses his motorbike. He loads milk cans on his bike and delivers them early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs. He has to afford the expense for fodder and the whole household expenses alone. 

Therefore, M. Shafique requested from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy an additional buffalo to get more milk to sell. With the profit amount, he can easily buy the fodder for his herd.  M. Shafique wants to increase his herd by purchasing more cattle so that he could cherish his whole family in well manners.  M. Shafique thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Heqiqet

texts.en:
Heqiqet is 54 year old. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two daughters. Their two daughters are receiving an education. 

Heqiqet is engaged in agribusiness. She is a very energetic and hardworking woman. She grows vegetables on her inherited piece of land. She sells her harvest in the local market and earns money for a livelihood, but her income is too low to run a family of four members well. 

So Heqiqet has decided to start a new business selling milk and dairy products.

Heqiqet applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy a dairy cow. 

Her plan is to start a milk supply and dairy products (butter, curd, paneer, etc.) business. She wants to supply milk and dairy products door-to-door in her locality and in the local market. These products are in great demand in the present market.

Her full thanks go to Aqroinvest CU and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 57 años de edad habita en condiciones muy  sencillas junto a su compañero de vida, mamá e hijos, en casa propia.  Isabel se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas como: pastelitos de carne, enchiladas, etc. El negocio lo tiene en su lugar de habitación y gracias a la calidad y buenos precios ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día la prefieren más.  Isabel solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila ya que la  que tiene se encuentra dañada y además, desea construir un baño. Con el crédito comprará cemento,ladrillo, arena, grava y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así comenzar la construcción de la pila y el baño lo antes posible que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Isabel is 57 years old and lives in her own, very simple house with her life partner, mother and children. Isabel works selling typical meals, such as meat pies and enchiladas, and more.  She runs the business out of her home and, thanks to the good quality and affordable price, she has managed to gain the trust of many customers who prefer to come to Isabel's stall every day.  Isabel is apply for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in building a basin in her home as the one she currently has is damaged.  She would also like build a bathroom.  Isabel will use this loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel and iron.  Isabel hopes to be able to count on this loan and to start building the basin and bathroom she so desperately needs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel and iron in order to construct a bathroom and basin.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер глубоко духовный и верующий человек. Алишер растет пятерых детей. Двоих дочерей и троих сыновей. Старшей дочери 15 лет она помогает своим родителям присматривать за братьями и сестрой. Алишер кормит свою семью за счет продажи авто запчастей. Такая работа приносит ему не большой доход. Потребности клиентов возрастают, спрос на новые виды запчастей увеличиваются и Алишер просит кредит, чтобы купить новые запчасти. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. В надежде, что вы ему поможете!
texts.en: Alisher is a deeply spiritual and religious person. Alisher is raising five children: two daughters and three sons. The eldest daughter, who is 15 years old, helps her parents to watch over her brothers and sister. Alisher feeds his family by selling auto parts. This work brings him no large income. The needs of customers grow, demand for new types of parts increases, and Alisher is requesting a loan to buy new parts. With this aim, he applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continúa trabajando en una entidad del estado pero en sus horas libres continuas dedicándose  atender su bar y le va muy bien. 

Margot pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Margot is grateful to investors for her previous loan and is happy with the support provided.  She continues to work for a state entity but, in her spare time, she is still running her bar and this is going very well.

Margot has been part of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank for many years.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy beverages such as beer and fizzy drinks. Margot is grateful for and knows the value of this loan. She promises to be responsible with her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to purchase drinks such as beer and sodas.

loans.name: Marys

texts.en:
Marys helps her husband in running their business to make a living. She has been doing this for three years, earning enough to provide for the needs of the family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell to boost her store. 

She is hopeful to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en:
Gervais is 30 years old. He is married, and has spent five years in the business. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is married, with eight children.  He operates his rice farm to make a living. 

After five years on the farm, Samson earned well so that he was able to provide the needs of the entire family. Samson always finds ways to augment the living of his family. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. 

He is hopes to gain more returns, and save a portion of it for a better future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a poultry business, selling chicks and eggs at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase chicken feed and chemicals to prevent diseases for her hens. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chemicals to prevent diseases for her hens.

loans.name: Nofel

texts.en:
Nofel is 45 years old and married. Even though he is young, he has four daughters. He takes care of the household and raises the children. He is a very diligent, responsible, kind, and careful by nature. 

Nofel raises livestock and plants crops to provide the main source of income for his family. He has 12 years of experience in this field.

Thanks to his hard work, Nofel now has four dairy cows and four hectares of land for planting potatoes and tomatoes every year. He has everything he needs to take care of the livestock. His monthly income is 120 AZN  from this business. 

In order to develop his farm, Nofel asked Aqroinvest CU and Kiva for a loan 1200 AZN to buy more cows. 

Nofel plans to use the profits to invest in more livestock, and to save money to improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es: Claudia de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su madre y dos hermanas. Ella trabaja como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y de esta forma ayuda a su familia con los gastos diarios. Es una joven muy trabajadora y responsable. Desea construir un baño para el cual es necesario pagar mano de obra  y comprar los materiales.
