Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena, y lámina galvanizada. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así dar inicio a la construcción del baño lo antes posible.
texts.en: Claudia is 22 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and two sisters.  Claudia works at an institution near her town and, with this work, she is able to help with living costs.  Claudia is a very hard-working and responsible young woman.  She wants to build a bathroom and so needs to pay for labourers and materials.  To do this work, Claudia is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, bricks, sand and galvanised laminate sheeting.  She hopes to be able to count on this support and then start building the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and galvanised laminate sheeting in order to build a bathroom.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Rosario” está constituida por 08 mujeres emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Ella es Rosa de 66 años de, separada con 05 hijos independientes. Lleva más de 06 años dedicándose a la venta de medias ambulatoria de medias, ropas interiores entre otros. Negocio que le ha permitido mejorar  su vivienda. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la  compra de  medias, pantis y ropas interiores. Su mayor deseo es de instalar  un puesto donde pueda exhibir  sus productos y de esta manera dejar de ofrecerlos ambulatoriamente. El grupo “El Rosario” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Rosa se encuentra de pie, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca roja.
texts.en: The "El Rosario" group has eight enterprising members who look to improve their lives every day.  One member of the group is 66-year-old Rosa.  She is separated, has five now independent children, and for six years she has been working selling socks, underwear and more as a street vendor.  This business has allowed Rosa to improve her home. On this occasion she is applying for a loan in order to buy socks, pants, and underwear. Her biggest dream is to have a stall where she can display her products and stop working as a street vendor.  The "El Rosario" group is grateful to those who are making this loan possible. In the photo, Rosa is second on the left, standing up, and wearing a dark red/pink top.

loans.use: to buy socks, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor tiene 26 años, vive en concubinato y tienen dos hijos a los que mantiene y ayuda en su educación. Es agricultor y tiene plantaciones de cítricos y arroz, trabaja todos los días del año para que a su familia no les falte nada. Vive en una casa que se compró hace varios años en la población de Ivirgarzama, pero la misma tiene algunos desperfectos como goteras, muros rotos, etc. por ello solicita un crédito para refaccionar su vivienda, y así brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Victor is 26 years old and lives with his wife and their two children who he supports and helps pay for their education.  He works in agriculture and grows citrus fruits and rice.  He works every day of the year so that his family has what they need. 

He lives in a house in Ivirgarzama that he bought many years ago.  The house has many problems such as leaks, broken walls, etc.  He is seeking a loan so that he can repair the house in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María comenzó a construir su casa pero no logró concluirla, necesita terminar el área de la cocina, patio trasero y concluir otros detalles que son importantes para que la familia habite cómodamente en la vivienda. Ella solicita quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) con este dinero comprará los materiales necesarios para realizar los trabajos y mejoras de su vivienda. María agradece la oportunidad de finaciamiento que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: María began to build her house but was not able to complete the work - she needs to finish the kitchen, back patio, and do other little jobs so that the family is comfortable in the house.  María is applying for 500,000 Colones in order to buy the necessary material to do the necessary work and make the improvements to her home.  María is grateful for this opportunity of a loan with which she is being provided.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 35 years old. He is a father of three children between the ages of 5 and 12. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Kenia Carolina

texts.es:
La Joven Kenia  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en  una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Kenia su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha y necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia  prima  como maíz, leña y cal, para  seguir elaborando sus tortillas y  de  esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Kenia espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia. 
Kenia espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre   2013
texts.en:
Kenia is a hard-working and responsible person that lives with her family in a community in the southern region of Honduras.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living.

Kenia's business is well-known in the community and there is a lot of demand for her products.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as corn, wood, and lime, in order to continue making her tortillas and thus continue making an income, which is very important to her household.

Kenia wants to send her thanks for this loan because she will be able to buy the ingredients she needs to continue running her business and to meet the demand of her customers.  She will be able to increase her sales and her success will be reflected in an improved quality of life for her family.

Kenia hopes that her business continues to grow and that she will become more popular in the community, which will help her continue supporting her family so that they have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Balthazar

texts.en:
Balthazar is 46 years old; he is married, with 6 children. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Marta Blanca

texts.es: Marta de 43 años de edad habita en casa propia con su esposo y sus 4 hijos.  Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar y dan a sus hijos el sustento diario.  Marta posee una pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su  hogar de residencia. Su vivienda es su principal patrimonio y futura herencia para sus hijos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el repello de las  paredes de la vivienda para lo cual necesita comprar cemento y si es posible también comprará pintura. Espera poder contar con este  apoyo y así poder mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband a four children.  She and her husband maintain the household finances and provide their children with their daily sustenance.  Marta has a small store that she managed wit set up in her home with great effort.  Her home is her first priority and future inheritance for her children.  She is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, in order to cover the walls in her home.  She needs to buy cement and paint if possible.  She hopes to get this support so she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc, bricks, perlins, cement, sand, iron, and to pay manual laborers.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina continua dedicándose a la venta de comida y le va muy bien, ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, verduras, carne, fideos y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Guillermina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 42 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Guillermina continues to sell her food and all is going well.  She still belongs to the bank "Virgen del Rosario" and she needs a loan in order to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, noodles, and other things like these.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Guillermina was born in Paucartambo and she is 42 years old.  She is married with four children. She is a mother, a hard-worker, and an entrepreneur that works hard to help her family get by.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María de  65  años de edad, vive con su esposo no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad al sur  de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace  04  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y frescos.
Doña María también vende ropa que le mandan los hijos de los Estados Unidos, es  una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejora de vivienda.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de bloques, cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra,  con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su calidad de vida  y quiere aprovechar la época navideña para realizar estas mejoras ya que su cocina esta en malas condiciones, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma es un excelente cliente,  su sueño es terminar su cocina para este año.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 65 years old and lives with her husband.  They have no dependent children.  María lives in a community in southern Honduras.  She has her own home and has been in the business of selling groceries and soft drinks for four years.  Doña María also sells clothing that is shipped to her from her children in the United States.  She is an enterprising woman who greatly wants to succeed on behalf of her family.  

María is requesting a new loan for home improvements.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy blocks, cement, sand, as well as pay for labor.  With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her quality of life.  She also wants to take advantage of the Christmas season for making these improvements since her kitchen is in bad condition.  

This is the fourth loan she has requested from Prisma and she is an excellent client.  Her dream is to have her kitchen finished this year.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, as well as pay for labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Nelis

texts.es:
Doña Nelis es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su familia en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Nelis necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña y cal,  para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y de esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña Nelis espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
Doña Nelis espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Nelis is a hard-working and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in the southern region of Honduras.  She makes and sells tortillas.  Her business is well-known in the community and there is a lot of demand for her products.

Nelis is seeking a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as corn, wood, and lime, in order to continue making her tortillas and thus continue making an income, which is very important to her household.

Nelis says that thanks to this loan she will be able to buy the ingredients she needs to continue running her business and to meet the demand of her customers. She will be able to increase her sales and her success will be reflected in an improved quality of life for her family.

Nelis hopes that her business continues to grow and that she will become more popular in the community, which will help her continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (dyes, cosmetics, accessories, hair treatments),  replace her hair-dressing chairs and buy a hair iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, jackets, and pajamas.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old; he is a father of 4 children.  

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 52 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Monica has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Monica requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like coffee, milk, rice, spices, etc. for her business.

Monica has been in this business for 22 years; she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coffee, milk, rice, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 35 years old. He has been a farmer for the past five years. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and to pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Perla Jeniffer

texts.es:
Perla, es una joven soltera, vive junto a su madre y un hermano, se dedica a elaborar y vender bisutería y cosméticos, para cubrir sus gastos personales y aportar en los gastos familiares, está actividad la desempeña desde hace un año, no posee otro tipo de ayuda.
Comprará hilos, piedras, alambre, cadenas, cremas, lociones, labiales, etc., con lo que podre contar con los materiales para elaborar los diferentes tipos de piezas de bisutería como pulseras, anillos, collares, así como también tendrá más productos de belleza para ofrecer a sus clientes. Espera aprovechar la temporada y aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía.
Su sueño es independizarse y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Perla is a single young woman who lives with her mother and a brother.  She makes and sells trinkets and cosmetics in order to cover her personal expenses and to help with the family expenses.  Perla has been in this business for one year and receives no other type of assistance.  She will buy thread, stones, wire, chains, crèmes, lotions, lipsticks, and other items.  Perla will have cash for the materials she uses for making different types of trinkets such as 
bracelets, rings, and necklaces.  She will also have more beauty products to offer to her customers.  

Perla hopes to take advantage of this season to increase her sales and improve her financial situation.  Her dream is to become independent and buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy thread, stones, wire, chains, crèmes, lotions, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.name: Olga Cecilia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer carismática y noble, que ha luchado incansablemente para ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honrada. Hace muchos años aprendió el oficio de estilista en un curso de capacitación en belleza que realizó en una academia; luego comenzó a trabajar en diferentes peluquerías del municipio, donde adquirió experiencia y amplió sus conocimientos, esto la impulsó a independizarse y hace 12 años montó su propio salón de belleza en un espacio que adecuó en su vivienda; allí presta el servicio de corte, cepillado, manicure, pedicure, químicos, entre otros y así ha logrado generar ingresos para sustentar las necesidades básicas del hogar. 
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (shampoo, acondicionador, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes paras uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su actividad y poder seguir siendo productiva; pues a sus 59 años de edad, manifiesta que aún sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio y seguir haciendo lo que le gusta, porque todavía tiene energía y su edad no le impide trabajar día a día, así podrá disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y más adelante tendrá la capacidad de tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias.
texts.en:
Olga is a charismatic and noble woman who has struggled ceaselessly to make her living in a dignified and honorable way. Many years ago she learned to be a stylist through a beautician course in an academy. She started to work in various hair salons in the city where she gained experience and expanded her knowledge. This made her want to work independently and 12 years ago she opened her own beauty salon in a space she adapted in her house. She offers hair cuts, brushing, manicures, pedicures, chemical skin treatments, etc. She generates the income she needs to pay the basic necessities of her household. 

With the desire to strengthen her business, Olga is requesting a loan to buy supplies wholesale ( shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish, etc.). This will allow her to continue with her work and continue being active. Even at 59 years old she says she wants to continue with her business and keep on doing what she enjoys. She still has energy and her age doesn't stop her from working day to day. This way she can enjoy better well-being and also be able to enjoy her old age without worrying about money.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad tiene dos hijos menores de edad (de 14 y de 2 años de edad) y junto a su compañero de vida desean que ellos tengan una mejor vida. María se dedica desde hace cinco años a trabajar en la temporada de la zafra, en roza o corte de caña de azúcar. Una labor ardua pero que ella realiza para apoyar la economía de su hogar. María desea mejorar las paredes de su humilde casa sustituyendo la madera y plástico por una de lámina galvanizada y cuartones de pino en su estructura. Ya que no tiene todo el dinero para la construcción ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito para comprar la Lámina galvanizada, clavos para lámina y cuartones de madera de pino; así con el apoyo del compañero de vida realizarían las mejoras a su vivienda y cancelarían las cuotas de dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and has two young children (one is 14 and the other is 2 years old). She and her husband dream that the kids can have a better life.  Maria has worked for the past 5 years during the sugar harvest season - she cuts the sugar cane.  This is arduous work but she does it in order to support her household.

Maria wants to improve the walls of her humble home by substituting the current wood and plastic for galvanized sheets and pine. She does not have the money she needs for the construction and so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI in order to buy galvanized sheets, fasteners and pine. With the support of her husband, they will improve the house and then pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, fasteners, and pine to fix the walls of her house.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 52 años de edad vive en terreno propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Jorge ha levantado poco a poco su humilde vivienda y a pesar de trabajar en Mantenimiento y albañilería no ha podido construir su vivienda con materiales más resistentes y duraderos. Es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para construir las paredes de su vivienda, que como se aprecia en la fotografía actualmente son de plástico negro. Espera tener el apoyo, comprometiéndose a cancelar puntualmente las cuotas que implican este crédito.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their three young children. Little by little Jorge has improved his humble home, but in spite of his work in maintenance and masonry, he has not been able to build his home with durable or strong materials.

Because of this, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI so that he can buy galvanized sheets, fasteners, and wood to construct the walls of his home.  As we can see in the photo, the current walls are really just black plastic.  He hopes to receive the support and he promises to repay the loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, fasteners, and wood in order to build the walls of his home.

loans.name: Mahjabeen

texts.en:
Mahjabeen, a 23-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, son, and 2 daughters. One son and both daughters are studying, and her husband is a barbar. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Mahjabeen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will expand her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Mahjabeen has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. 

She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 41 years old; he is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 16. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myrna has been in this business for six years now.

Myrna requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 32 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y sigue contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con el negocio de venta de comida donde expende diferentes platos  típicos de la región como por ejemplo, arroz con huevo, pescado frito, caldo de gallina, malaya frita y otros, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, latas de leche, bolsas de fideos y botellas de aceite y otros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is thankful to the lenders for the loan and she is very content with the support it has provided her.  She continues to sell homemade food - she makes typical Peruvian dishes from the region such as rice with egg, fried fish, chicken soup, Peruvian beef, and others.

She has belonged to the "Virgen del Rosario" community bank for many years.  She is seeking this loan in order to buy ingredients such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, cans of milk, bags of pasta, bottles of oil, etc.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bags of rice and sugar, cans of milk, pasta, and bottles of oil.

loans.name: Modesta Rosa

texts.es: Doña Modesta es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y mantener la pulpería. Solicita el nuevo crédito para la compra de productos varios tales como: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Gaseosas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doña Modesta is originally from the city of Granada. She is a merchant by trade who manages a grocery business. Modesta is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because she will be able to increase her sales and maintain her store.

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy various products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sodas, and other items. Modesta expects this loan to be of great help since she will be able to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, such as coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, bread, etc. to resell.

Teresita has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, bread, etc. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, such as coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, bread, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra works hard to support her family. Petra is married and has a computer gaming station business in the Philippines.

Petra requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her business.

Petra has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Petra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her business.

loans.name: Tamerlan

texts.en:
Tamerlan is a freshman in the Human Rights Program. This is his story:

There are lots of people in the world, and each is an individual with individual rights. There are many lawyers in my country, but there are not many lawyers who take difficult or political cases for people who have no money. AUCA has just opened a new program in Human Rights, and I want to be one of the first specialists in this field to graduate from in my country.

AUCA also has an American style of education, which is not possible at other universities in Kyrgyzstan. It means that I will have the opportunity to meet interesting lawyers from Europe and the United States. It also means that I will be able to earn my education honestly and that I can have a lot of interesting extracurricular activities.

I have always wanted to help those who do not have as many advantages as I have. AUCA’s new program will give me the chance to realize my goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition for higher education.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.en:
Kanykei is a freshman in the Software Engineering program. This is her story: 

I chose software engineering because good specialists are in demand in all branches of the economy. Information Technology is an integral part of society, and people who can create and develop complicated systems and databases have the ability to change people’s lives.

Since childhood, I have been interested in mathematics and informatics. When I was five years old, my mother asked me what I loved more: solving math problems or writing. I did not have to think about it, and then my parents enrolled me in school #61, the strongest school in Bishkek for mathematics.

Ideally, I would like to apply my degree to benefit my country through systematization of all branches of the government and economy, to eradicate corruption and improve the lives of our citizens. I think a degree from AUCA will help me achieve my plans.

loans.use: to pay tuition for higher education.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Maria es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de dos hijos ya independientes. Tiene 63 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, de dedica a la venta de productos varios (cosméticos y productos de limpieza). Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, con el dinero de su jubilación. Poco a poco fue comprando productos para vender. Hoy en día cuenta con una venta sostenible y variedad de productos. Su meta próxima es instalar una tienda para ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar cosméticos, desinfectantes para el hogar, entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra comprar una variedad de productos para ofertarlos al mercado. Su plan futuro es seguir aumentando la diversidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is originally from Granada. She is married and the mother of two children are already independent. Maria is 63 years old and a merchant by trade. She sells various products, such as cosmetics and cleaning products. Maria started her business a few years ago with the money from her retirement pension. Over time, she bought products to sell. Today she has a sustainable business that offers a variety of products.

Her next goal is to open a store where she can offer customers various products. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy cosmetics, household disinfectants, and other items in order to fulfill her customers' orders. Maria believes this loan will be of great help since she will be able to buy a variety of products that she can offer in the marketplace. Her future plans include continuing to increase the diversity of her products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, household disinfectants, and other products.

loans.name: Julian Ernesto

texts.es:
El es julian, un joven emprendedor que después de pasar por muchos problemas familiares, económicos,de convivencia, académicos decidió iniciar con su proyecto de vida, estudiando auxiliar de enfermería en la institución campo alto. El sueño de este peculiar joven menor de tres hermanos es llegar a ser un gran medico para a si poder llegar a ayudar a la familia y a las personas mas necesitadas que su servicio y amabilidad soliciten.
El sueño de este joven nace de un hecho trágico, después de el fallecimiento de su padre, y ver que por diferentes errores y calamidades en el sistema de salud ocurrió este lamentable hecho, decide iniciar el camino a ser un gran medico y con su vocación y amor por esta profesión lo lograra.
Por otra parte en la vida de este joven, antes de esta decisión, hubo una época de malas decisiones y malas amistades, que pro poco acaban con la salud de el, y la salud mental de la mama, una psicóloga que después de tener tres hijos y casi quince años de no estudiar, decidió sacar a flote la vida académica y la familia, por este apoyo y ejemplo de la mama el joven julian sera un gran profesional útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
This is Julian, who is a young entrepreneur. After experiencing many family, financial, relationship, and academic problems, he decided to start his own life project by studying to become a nursing assistant at CampoAlto. The dream of this youngest of three siblings is to eventually become a successful doctor so that he can help his family and people who are in the most need of his services and friendly treatment.

The dream of this young man originated out of tragedy. After the death of his father, he saw various mistakes and mishaps that occurred within in the health system as a result of this unfortunate event. He decided to begin down the path toward pursuing medicine as his vocation and developing a love for this profession.

Prior to making this decision, another aspect of this young man’s life was a period when he made bad decisions and spent time with the wrong crowd. Eventually this affected his health as well as the mental health of his mother, who became a psychologist after having her three children. After 15 years of not pursuing his studies, Julian has now decided to keep his academic life and his family afloat. With the support and the example set by his mother, young Julian wants to become a successful professional who will be of use to society.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Litzi Daniela

texts.es: La señora Litzi tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de masitas (rollos, empanadas, brazo gitano, alfajores) que son vendidos en las entidades financieras, si bien la cliente tiene otra profesión no la ejerce, porque tiene dos hijos que están pequeños y no hay quien pueda cuidarlos. 	Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de roscas navideñas, dado que en esta época del año son muy solicitadas y de esta forma podrá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Litzi is 35 years old, married and sells pastries (rolls, empanadas, jelly rolls, sandwich cookies) to financial institutions.  This is her only job because she has two small children and there is no one else who can take care of them.  She is asking for a loan to buy supplies to make Christmas ring cakes, given that they are in high demand this time of year and she can increase her sales and income with which to cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Custodia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 45 años de edad, criada en el campo donde aprendió a realizar todas las actividades agropecuarias, las mismas que hoy en día le permiten generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y con el sustento diario de sus 4 hijos. Inició su negocio de manera independiente, criando y comercializando cerdos, pero decidió cambiar de actividad y ahora se dedica a producir y comercializar leche. Es una persona carismática y amable, siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su actividad, con el dinero comprará una vaca productora de leche y cancelará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; esto le ayudará a incrementar la producción y generar mayor nivel de ganancias por las ventas.
María manifiesta que su principal interés es poder continuar con su negocio y aprovechar el espacio que tiene en su finca para seguir produciendo y, apoyando a sus hijos para que tengan una educación de mejor calidad y, en un futuro puedan ser profesionales íntegros que salgan adelante y se forjen una vida exitosa.
texts.en:
María is a 45-year-old woman who was raised in the country, where she learned everything about farming activities. This knowledge enables her to generate income today so that she can help her husband with the household finances and provide for the daily needs of their four children. María started her business independently by raising and selling pigs, but she later decided to transition her business to producing and selling milk, which is the line of work she is pursuing now.

She is a charismatic and friendly person who is always looking for new alternatives that will help her keep advancing. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to strengthen her business. The money will be used to buy a milk-producing cow and to pay off the balance of an outstanding debt. This will help to increase production and generate a higher level of profit from her sales.

María says that her main interest is continuing her business and taking advantage of the space on her farm in order to continue production. This will enable her to support her children by providing them a better quality education. In the future, she wants them to become well-rounded individuals who can forge ahead and have a successful life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and to repay an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre luchador y humilde de 53 años de edad, que siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan dar a sus 4 hijos un mejor bienestar.
Hace 31 años trabaja como comerciante independiente, ha tenido varios negocios entre los que se cuenta venta de mercancía, de frutas y verduras, entre otros. Actualmente se dedica a vender alimentos fritos en un carrito ambulante, trabaja todos los días de 10 am a 9 pm y además genera un empleo directo. El oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y así ha generado los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
Con el firme propósito de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (aceite, papa criolla, papa capira, plátanos, salsas, gaseosas, aceite y productos desechables), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente para atender la demanda y aumentar sus ventas en la temporada escolar que comienza, para así generar mayor nivel de utilidades.
Luis con su empuje, perseverancia y esfuerzo desea hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una microempresa de producción y comercialización de alimentos fritos con marca propia registrada, así estará en la capacidad de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, 53, is a hard-working and humble man who is always looking for ways to improve his four children's well-beings.

For 31 years, he has worked as an independent vendor. He has had various businesses, including selling merchandise, fruits and vegetables, and more. He currently works by selling fried foods in a traveling cart. He works every day from 10 am to 9 pm. He also has a direct employee. He learned this skill by observing others, which has provided him with sufficient resources to support his family on a daily basis.

With a firm goal of strengthening his business, he is requesting a loan to buy wholesale products such as cooking oil, potatoes, yellow potatoes, bananas, sauces, drinks, and disposable products. This will allow him to have enough capital to attend to demand and increase his sales when the school year begins, which will generate more income.

With his drive, perseverance, and effort, he hopes to grow his business and convert it to a micro-business in fired food production and sales with a registered trademark. This would allow him to give his family a better well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products such as cooking oil, potatoes, yellow potatoes, bananas, sauces, drinks, and disposable products.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña María es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de dos hijos ya independientes. Tiene 55 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cajetas. Inicio su negocio hace varios años, ayudándole a su Mama en la elaboración de cajetas. Tiempo después, poco a poco fue independizándose. Actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio el cual ha ido creciendo. Su meta es expandirse a otros mercados de la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ingredientes tales como: Azúcar, leche, maní, coco, papaya entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque lograra cumplir con los pedidos y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mantener el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña María is originally from the city of Granada. She is married and the mother of two children who are already independent. María is 55 years old and a merchant by trade. She makes and sells caramels. María started in the business several years ago by helping her mother make the caramels. Over time, she eventually became independent. María now has her own business that is growing. Her goal is to expand into other markets in the city.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, peanuts, coconuts, papaya, and other items. She believes this loan will be of great help because she can fulfill her orders and generate more income. Her plan for the future is to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, peanuts, coconuts, papaya, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es: Ana trabaja como impulsadora de productos de belleza en una de las zonas de su Municipio. Ella vive en casa propia junto a su hija de 3 años de edad. Para dar mejor comodidad a su pequeña hija ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que tiene muchas fisuras y en época de invierno sufre de la filtración de agua. Con el monto del crédito comprará Madera, lámina galvanizada, clavos y pagará la mano de obra.  Está dispuesta a esforzarse y cumplir con las cuotas mensuales hasta saldar su crédito.
texts.en: Ana works as a beauty product promoter in one of the areas of her municipality.  She lives in her own home with her three-year-old daughter.  She has requested a loan from FUSAI to offer her young daughter better comfort by repairing the roof of her house as it has many cracks and water gets in in the wintertime.  With the money from the loan she will buy wood, galvanized sheet metal, and nails, and she will pay for labor.  She is ready to work hard and make her monthly payments until she has repaid her debt.

loans.use: to buy: wood, galvanized sheet metal, and nails, and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like rice, coconut, sugar, etc. for her business.

Virginia has been in this business for 14 years. Virginia earns more income from bag making.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like rice, coconut, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 32 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Arman is not married and he lives with his parents. For five years, Arman has distributed juices and canned foods from his own car. He delivers them to nearly 300 food shops throughout his region. Arman gets all the products from manufacturers and factories, and sometimes from the Yerevan wholesale markets. Arman plans to increase his assortment of juices and canned foods, but he doesn't have enough money.

Arman asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy new types of juice and canned foods, since he knows that closer to the New Year Holiday  period his orders will surely increase and be different.

loans.use: to buy new types of juice and canned foods, since he knows that closer to the New Year Holiday  period his orders will surely increase and be different.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz lives in the village Aygehovit in Tavush region. Nargiz has two already grown up children. Her daughter is married and she lives with her family. Her son is also married and with his family lives with his parents. Nargiz’s husband does constructional works, her son works as a warden, her daughter-in-law works as a cleaner, but all they together with Nargiz are engaged in farming and agriculture. Nargiz in her farm has one cow, two piglets, twenty two chickens and she with her family cultivates a plot of land, which gives harvest of apple, persimmon and fig. She also manages to sell meat and eggs of her farm right from her house.  
Nargiz asks a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow, two calves, several piglets and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow, two calves, several piglets and fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Paulo's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 5 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Paulo selected as the Kiva representative.  Paulo has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to his and the 52 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Paulo is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 5 children.  Paulo is 61 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 11 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Paulo is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Paulo’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in his community, Paulo also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and wants to help more farmers.  Paulo plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future, and invest in a business.  He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest and was able to feed the family.							

Paulo and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Veli

texts.en:
Veli is 47 years old, married with two children. He was unemployed for several years and to improve his family living condition, he started a farming business 21 years ago. Now this is the main source of income for his family. Raising and selling animals, milk products brings a stable income. 
A few years ago Veli got sick and once in a year he has to stay in hospital to get treatment. Due to this he needs 1600 AZN to cover his treatment costs at hospital.

loans.use: To cover hospital costs.

loans.name: Meruna

texts.en:
Meruna is 22 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a housewife. Meruna is from the remote village of Altagram, in Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She attended school up to class IV (Grade 4). She lives with her husband and children. Her husband, Anarul, is 29 years old and passed class V (Grade 5). Their son reads in class I (Grade 1) and their daughter is only 2 years old. They have a kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw).

Meruna's husband is a greengrocer. He grows different vegetables and crops and sells them to the local market. Now they have decided to grow potatoes. She knows potatoes are in great demand in their locality and in the present market.

Meruna came to know about Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) and applied for a loan. She wants to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers with the loan. She hopes there will be great profit from this business, and she will be able to meet the financial needs of her family and give better education to her children with the earnings from her business. She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Gibblen's Group

texts.en:
Gibblen is a member of this group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 57 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Gibblen has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Gibblen is married and has 8 children.  He is 66 years old and is known as hardworking.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group.  Gibblen has been a farmer for 5 years.  Gibblen described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Gibblen joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Gibblen joined One Acre Fund so that he could earn enough to feed family.  Because he is an active community member, Gibblen has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Gibblen's life because he was able to feed the family.  In the future, Gibblen hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to buy a cow.  	

Gibblen and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married with two children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for two years. She applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bundles of used shoes. She generates additional income from selling used clothes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of used shoes.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children).

Alex has a business of selling milk and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cans of milk. She generates additional income from poultry farming. She moves door to door selling and sells to all categories of people both by retail and wholesale, seven days out of every week.

Alex's business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to sell only by wholesale.  Alex resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cans of milk.

loans.name: Nadia Maribel

texts.es:
La joven Nadia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería y venta de productos avon, desde hace 5 años.
Nadia su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive, necesita el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, manteca, arroz, huevos, etc.
Nadia desea seguir realizando su trabajo el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y con esta ayuda poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
Nadia su sueño es que en un corto plazo su negocio crezca  y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del  2013
texts.en:
Young Nadia is a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family.  For five years, her business has been a small grocery store and selling Avon products.

Nadia has her business in her home in the municipality where she lives.  She needs this loan to buy beans, sugar, coffee, bread, lard, rice, eggs, etc. 

Nadia wants to keep doing her work, which brings in a large part of her income.  She hopes that her sales will increase with her loan and that it will go a long way because she does not have the products she needs to cover her customers' daily orders.  With this help she will be able to improve her family's quality of life. 

Nadia's dream is to grow her business in a short period of time, which would allow her to keep supporting her family so they get the education they need to have greater opportunities in life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – November  2013

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, coffee, bread, lard, rice, eggs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar has successfully established her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She enjoys a great client list and makes enough money to bear her household expenditures. Previously, Kosar took a Kiva loan to purchase the required stitching material. To cope with the increasing customer demand, she has again requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Kosar expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing good quality education to her children through all her hard work with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen has successfully established her business, selling fruits and juices, with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. They have become famous in their community for selling good quality juices and they make enough to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, Perveen took a Kiva loan to purchase a juicer machine and some ingredients. Now she has requested another loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase sacks of oranges, along with a new juicer machine. This will help them to meet the increasing demands of their customers consistently. Perveen expects a boost in her earnings and desires to use part of the earned profits towards the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges along with a new juicer machine.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. Erma is married and has a fabric printing service business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paint, etc. for her business. Erma has been in this business for 14 years now.

Erma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, paint, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu is a married woman with nine children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanatibu prepares sweet dumplings and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar, age 39, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys baby goats and sheep at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. At present she has four goats and three sheep. She makes enough, through her business, to contribute to the family income. 

Kishwar needs to improve her business to bear the expenses of her household. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and hert income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Doña Nelly gracias a su primer financiamiento pudo comprar y asistir sus cultivos de granos básicos comprando abono y fertilizantes entre otros con los cuales asistió y sembró 2 manzanas de maíz obteniendo una cosecha de 30 cargas de las cuales vendió 12 nada más con lo que obtuvo pocos ingresos y logro poner al día parte de su financiamiento reteniendo la otra cantidad de cargas ya que los precios de compra en el mercado que a ella le ofrecen considera son muy bajos y quieren aprovecharse de la necesidad de venta como productora ya que hay exceso de producción en el país. 
Por lo que ella ha solicitado una segunda oportunidad para poder adquirir un segundo financiamiento con el cual cultivara la postrera y esperara a que el precio del maíz mejore en el mercado para poder sacarlo a la venta y obtener buenos resultados ya que con las ganancias esperadas ella espera salir de su compromiso y re invertir en la siembra y asistencia de su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan, Nelly was able to buy and tend to her staple grain crops by buying fertilizers and other things that she used to plant and tend to 2 manzanas of corn.  She had a harvest of 30 cargas, of which she only sold 12.  With the small profits she earned she was able to repay part of her loan while keeping the rest of her cargas because the buying prices she was offered at market are very low and they want to take advantage of the growers' need to sell as there is excessive production in the country. 

She is asking for a second chance to take out a second loan that she will use to grow the last of her crops in hopes that the price of corn at market will improve so she can sell it for a good profit, as she hopes to repay her debt with her projected earnings and reinvest in growing and maintaining her coffee crops.

loans.use: to maintain her land and grow the last of her corn crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated sheet metal, pinewood, and nails for sheet metal to build a kitchen

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of five children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (step children).  She has a pub and has been in business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. She generates additional income from a restaurant, and her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por  el apoyo brindado, ella continua administrando su pequeña librería y heladería y le va muy bien y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo helados, gaseosas, agua mineral, regalos, peluches, tarjetas navideñas, papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos y otras cosa más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Maria nació en la ciudad de Cusco pero ahora vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 49 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria thanks the lenders for her loan and for the support they have offered.  She is still managing her small bookstore and ice cream shop and it is going very well for her.  This time she needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as ice cream, sodas, mineral water, gifts, stuffed animals, Christmas cards, paper, pens, notebooks, and other things.  She is thankful for and appreciates her loan and she promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.  

Maria was born in the city of Cusco, but she now lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo.  She is 49 years old and she has a partner with whom she has two children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who gets her family ahead with the effort she puts into her work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as ice cream, sodas, mineral water, gifts, stuffed animals, Christmas cards, paper, pens, notebooks, and other things

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 21 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y Natalia trabaja desde hace 7 años en época de la zafra en el corte y roza de caña. Natalia tiene la oportunidad de adquirir un crédito de FUSAI para terminar de construir y colocar los tubos de concreto a un pozo de agua potable que tiene en su propiedad. Con el dinero comprará la arena, grava, hierro y cemento para la elaboración de los tubos de concreto.
texts.en: Natalia is 38 and lives in her own home with her life partner and their children, who are 21 and 12 years old.  Her partner has a farming business and for seven years Natalia has worked during sugar cane harvests cutting and clearing.  Natalia has an opportunity to receive a loan from FUSAI to finish building and laying concrete pipes for a drinking well they have on their property.  With the money she will buy sand, gravel, iron, and cement to make the concrete pipes.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, iron, and cement to make concrete pipes

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 35 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rowena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carla Ernestina

texts.es: Carla es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene 38 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y de cafetín. Inicio este negocio hace varios años, vendiendo golosinas. Luego, poco a poco fue vendiendo granos básicos en compañía de su esposo. Después le salió la oportunidad de vender en un kiosko. Hasta la fecha ha ido creciendo en su negocio. Su meta es mejorar su casa y comprar una vitrina. Solicita el crédito para comprar: papel higiénico, lácteos, jabones, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad de productos que más demanda los clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ganancias y así invertir aún más en el negocio. Su plan futuro es tener una tienda para seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Carla is originally from the city of Boaco.  She is 38 years old, married and has two children.  She has a general store and café and started this business several years ago, selling snacks.  She then began selling basic grains little by little with her husband and later got the chance to sell from a Kiosk.  To date she has been growing her business and her goals are to make improvements to her home and buy a display case.  She is asking for a loan to buy bathroom tissue, dairy products, soaps, rice, sugar, soft drinks, and other things so she can offer a variety of products that her customers demand the most.  She estimates that the loan will be of great help and that she will obtain better earnings.  This will allow her to invest more into her business.  Her future plans are to have a store so she can keep growing her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.ru: Шукуру  40 лет. Он живет в сельской местности недалеко от города. Семья его состоит из пяти человек. Он женат, имеет троих детей. Его жена работает  в дехканском хозяйстве. Основным источником дохода его семьи является животноводство. Дополнительно он еще  занимается и ловлей рыбы.    В будущем  Шукур собирается увеличить поголовье скота так, как дети растут и конечно же он хочет дать своим детям хорошее образование. Сейчас дети поддерживают его бизнес и всячески помогают ему. Ведь сельские дети с детства приучаются к  труду и вместе с родителями занимаются животноводством и земледелием.    В настоящее время  Шукуру необходимо накупить много сена и различного корма, так как он должен запастись кормом на зиму.  Чтобы его скот не истощал от  недостатка корма зимой  он обратился в Арванд, для финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en:
Shukur is 40 and lives in a village on the outskirts of a city.  He has 5 people in his family (including himself); he's married and has 3 kids.  His wife works on a dekhan farm, and their family's main source of income comes from raising livestock, while Shukur earns a little extra money on the side by catching & selling fish.  

In the future, Shukur hopes to get more livestock as his children are growing up, and he wants to be able to provide for their education.   His children help him with the family business as best they can; it's normal for children who grow up in Tajik villages to help their parents tend to their farms, and Shukur's children are no exception.  At present, Shukur needs to stock up on hay and other kinds of animal feed to prepare for the oncoming winter; as such, he's seeking a loan from Arvand to buy feed for his livestock so they'll have enough to eat through the winter and maintain their weight.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Jesulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESULOME est composé de quatorze personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Julienne (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) âgée de 47 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Julienne est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Adjaï. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Julienne vend du vin de palme à son domicile depuis vingt ans. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend du maïs. Julienne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Julienne ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESULOME sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The JESULOME group is made up of fourteen women who are all friends and live in the same village. The group leader is called Julienne (her hand is raised in the photo), and is 47 years old; she never attended school. In order to boost their business activities and to better serve their customers' needs, the group is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. Julienne is married to a farmer called Adjaï. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Julienne lives with her husband and children. The couple look after their family's needs together. In order to do this Julienne has sold palm wine from her home for twenty years. As a secondary concern, Julienne sells maize. She sources her goods from a market in Benin. In order to boost her business levels and to meet her customers' demand, Julienne and the members of JESULOME are seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans have all been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase palm wine and maize

loans.name: Yessica Natalia

texts.es: Jessica agrdece a los inversionitas por el prestamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua vendidendo cerveza y comida entonces tiene una pequeña tienda donde expende sus productos, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, latas de leche, bolsas de fideos y botellas de aceite.
texts.en: Jessica is grateful to the lenders for this loan and she is happy for the support.  She continues to sell beer and food and has a small store.  She is has been a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank for several years.  She needs a loan to buy supplies such as sacks of rice and sugar, cans of milk, bags of noodles, and bottles of cooking oil.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo y es profesora pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carnes, fideos y otras cosa más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Flora lives in the lovely city of Paucartambo and works as a teacher.  She sells food in her free time and has a small restaurant.  She has been a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank for several years.  She needs a loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, meats, noodles, and other things.  She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to making her payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gerald's Group

texts.en:
Gerald is a member of this group in the Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 83 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Gerald has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Gerald is married and has 2 children.  He is 52 years old and is known as a reliable and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and savings group.  Gerald has been a farmer for 3 years.  Gerald described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Gerald first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season.  Gerald joined One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers.
